Reviews.Title: “great choice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alli72
Reviews.Content: situated about 6 minute walk from main Termini, but another subway station just around the corner which is very handy. reception not grand but staff very helpful and friendly, give you a map and point out places of interest. room was in annex, just a few yards down the road, feels secure as need hotel room key to gain access and then again for another interior door, before getting to your room door. room not overly big but very sufficient with fridge and safe and tv, bathroom lovely and clean. quiet room with blackout shutters, cleaned daily. would definitely recommend for others who are there for sightseeing. nice places to eat in area which is great after a full day of walking. they keep your luggage too in a secure room if you check out but aren't travelling unil later.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff made 3* into 5*”
Reviews.Author: tricksySwansea
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, simple basic 3* hotel with no frills but 5* staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Mattandrews
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. The staff were very helpful and speak very good English. The rooms are small but very clean. We walked all over Rome from the hotel. It takes around 20-30 minutes to walk to most main sites. This lets you see other bits of Rome as you walk around the city. The metro is less the a 5 minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big and clean”
Reviews.Author: VrmSjm1018
Reviews.Content: The room was big compared to the last two we stayed in (london and Paris). The staff wa very friendly and the room was very clean!!! Great location if you want to get away from the tourist- metro stop is a block away. One suggestion to the hotel- post signs telling people not to slam the doors. The hotel cannot control this type of noise but it would help.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: milkdoctor
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were allowed early check in. Located close to the train station so easy to access all the major attractions in Rome. hotel staff very friendly and helpful. breakfast provided was great. Walls were thin and could hear people around us but this is what I expect throughout Europe so not a surprise for me. The room was clean and nicely furnished looked like just recently updated. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Rome 4 nights”
Reviews.Author: Koshkey
Reviews.Content: Good location, near train station, 5 blocks away. The bed was comfortable, I slept well. The room was quiet and spacious. The room was decorated well with pictures. I shared a room and made a friend. 1.50 Euro for breakfast was good. I wish I was back there.

Reviews.Title: “Good simple hotel, goods beds for tall persons ( 1,93)”
Reviews.Author: Runner10K
Reviews.Content: We have had a good time in ths Hotel, good breakfast nice people. Rooms are clean and daily correct. Rooms are not big, buth for tourist trips good Nearly by Metro and Termini. The historal centre of Rome is simply to reach. Perfect place quiet street, simple restaurants within 100 meters.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: europe2ur
Reviews.Content: the rooms are really nice, looks new and clean. Excellent location - 5min from Termini station and also plenty of affordable places to eat walking distance from the hotel. breakfast is excellent puts you in a good mood to start the day. the staff are pleasant. the rooms are spacious. we were on a Europe tour and this was the best hotel we stayed in compared to our paris and amsterdam hotels. I do recommend that you book directly with the hotel internet site as they give good deals but you must pay the whole amount when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Andrei G
Reviews.Content: everything was good and nice except the heating system failed and it was february so still a bit chill. personel were very careful and nice, and the location is superb. will go back there next time we're in Roma

Reviews.Title: “The fifth stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frances39
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel. Well appointed, with efficient and friendly staff. Especially recommend the restaurant around the corner. Mamma Angela.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay for your vacation”
Reviews.Author: kwilco
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed three nights at hotel des artistes for part of our honeymoon. having never been to rome before, i relied heavily on trip advisor suggestions for a good hotel. we were both incredibly pleased with this hotel! it's conveniently located in that it's maybe a block walk from the metra and about a 10-15 walk from the main terminal, which is excellent if you plan on taking the train, bus, ect. during your stay. the rooms were simple and clean, and fairly large considering it was rome. we had a queen sized bed and a bath with an adequate shower, toilet, bidet, sink and towel warmer. there is a wonderful rooftop patio that i recommend visiting in the evening with a bottle of wine. it was a great way to relax and unwind after a long day of walking. the staff was very nice and spoke well enough english that we never a problem communicating. they were happy to answer any questions we had. we never felt intimidated approaching them with questions. the lift is small, but you're in europe, so i don't know what else you'd expect. we easily fit both of our luggage and ourselves in it, though honestly we used the stairs most of the time. as far as being close the attractions, you'll probably want to take the metra to visit them, however we easily walked to the colosseum one day while the metra and buses were on strike (typically european). it was probably a 30-40 walk, but quite a wonderful way to see the sights. since it's centrally located, it's a pretty heavy touristy area, which is i wouldn't recommend eating at a lot of the restaurants close by. if you want a great meal, travel to trastevere. it's a bit of a haul to get there (taking the metra, then transferring to bus, so make sure you plan that out ahead of time), however it's an amazing are of town with great nightlife and a plethora of delicious restaurants to chose. we'd happily return to des artistes on our next rip to rome!

Reviews.Title: “Rome - Hotel Des Artistes”
Reviews.Author: LMR66
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Hotel Des Artistes was very nice and all staff is really receptive. The room is very clean, comfortable and well equipped. Also, the breakfast is varied and good. LMR - Brasil

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome, wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Daren L
Reviews.Content: A great value for money hotel, close to Termini and a metro stop. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the breakfast had plenty of choice to get you ready for a day of sightseeing. Bedrooms are all comfortable and very unique, a far cry from the Travel Lodges of this world. And plenty of hot water with a shower that will knock you off your feet! I think you would find it hard to find a better value 3 star property in Rome - we would definitely stay here again when we next visit Rome. Thank you everyone at Des Artistes for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Investigative
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated about 500m (10min) from Termini Station and if you come to Rome by plane, Termini is where buses from both Ciampino and Fiumicino airports get you. Landing in Ciampino, we entered our hotel room in an hour after leaving the airport (40 min bus drive to Termini). Des Artistes is located in a tenement house. Every storey of the building is of a different hotel (3 in total) and all the guests meet in the restaurant on the first floor where breakfast (sausages, eggs and bacon, rolls, croissants, cheese, ham, cereal, fruit, coffee, tea, milk, juice – all fresh and tasty) is served. The guys on a 24/7 reception desk are friendly and used to international guests. Our double room was very clean and cleaned well every day. As it was February, we used air conditioning for heating and had no problems with it. We slept well – the bed was comfortable and there were no noises from the street (short and narrow with one or two other hotels and a restaurant). The nearest metro station is just around the corner, about 150m from the hotel (Castro Pretorio, Line B), which makes travelling around the city really easy. The nearest supermarket (inexpensive food and alcohol) is also quite close, on Via San Martino della Battaglia. We chose Des Artistes for a 4 day city break and I can totally recommend this hotel for such a stay.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: MaeveAndDenise
Reviews.Content: Hotel Des Artistes was great value for four nights in low season. Its close to the metro and termini, in a safe, quiet area. The staff were helpful and breakfast was very good, especially compared to hotels in a similar price range. Reception is on the fifth floor, but there is a lift.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice, for a limited budget”
Reviews.Author: Holta_O
Reviews.Content: If you want to spend some days in Rome and you have a limited budget this hotel is a very good choice. It is 7 min walking from Ternimi station and has a metro stop 2 min away. The staff is very friendly and helpful for any questions. The rooms are small, but very clean. The breakfast is ok, nothing special, but the basic things were of a good quality. We stayed in the most cold days of this winter, but the rooms were very warm. Nothing bad to say about this hotel. If you don't expect a luxury staying, hotel Des Artistes is perfect for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: h0lidaymaker11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Des Artistes Hotel for 3 nights bed and breakfast. Hotel was clean and nicely decorated. Rooms were spotless but we couldn't get the heating to work so was abit chilly in the room. Bathroom very nice, good shower, hairdryer and good heating. Flat screen tv in the room which was good but couldn't seem to find any english tv channels but didn't bother us as we never had time to watch it anyway. Breakfast was good (sausage, bacon, egg, bread, ham, cheese, cereals etc). Hotel was in a excellent location - 5-10 minute walk from the Termini Station which is good for getting around Rome and to the airport. Managed to get a bus pass for 19 euros which lets you get around Rome on the 'hop on hop off' bus as many times as you want for the day - good value. Staff very friendly and helpful, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “More than impressed”
Reviews.Author: sinobres
Reviews.Content: The welcome we received by the two guys on reception was a great start to our trip. That was followed by maps and practical information about Rome. Our room was spotless, comfortable, spacious and quiet. Having the metro and Termini station near hand made Rome easy. We thought Des Artistes was great value and a great place to stay when visiting Rome. We could not find a single fault.

Reviews.Title: “"Exemplary Customer Service"”
Reviews.Author: mihaela m
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the christmas and I had a wonderful experience.On my arrival the staff were very welcoming and vey quick,and happy in answering my questions.My room was very clean and cofortable and in the morning I had the breakfast wich was very rich and satisfying,it gave me a good start to the day.I would definetly recommend this hotel to my friends as the time I spent here was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “very reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: jazpy82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is of walking distance from the Termini station however, i would not say that it is very near (maybe a 10-15min walk) . The reception is of a very small area. However, we were glad to see our room. It was just the room we need to recuperate from our food poisoning the previous day.The room is spacious and clean.By the Italian standard, the hotel would be considered cheap, however, it should be deemed reasonable by Asian travellers like me. Do not expect facilities like the 5 star hotels. The hotel does not have flat screen tv nor free wifi. The bathroom is not with faults but i would say it is due to old age. (by the italian standard, i think hotel des artistes is doing very well) We are also glad to find that the hotel has an antique looking lift which is still working. It is rather interesting for me since this was the first time i got to use this type of lift. Breakfast which was included in the hotel price was very worth our money. Considering the amount we paid for the breakfast (if i remember correctly , it should be 1.50Euros-3Euros) I would say the breakfast was terrific. again do not expect international buffet when u are paying peanuts for the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: elaric
Reviews.Content: Only a short walk with bags from Terravision airport bus at Termini, one block to Castro Pretorio Metro without crossing any roads. Warm welcome from friendly staff, good size room by Rome standards, nicely furnished and decorated, always hot water, very clean, decent fresh breakfast, overall good value, would stay there again. Our room was in a block 20 yards up the street from reception and breakfast and, while this didn't bother us, it's clearly not ideal for everyone and so just 4* rather than 5*.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: Olesya O
Reviews.Content: Hello! We accomodated this hotel from 4 till 6 of january 2012. The time we were there was very cool! We appriciate all staff of the hotel, they are really friendly, responsive, understanding. Hotel is situated in the heart of the city, it was very easy to take a transport to any sides of the city, futhermore it was a pleasure to strolling along the narrow beautiful streets. We really happy tj stay in this hotel and recommended to all staying there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Walkers”
Reviews.Author: Howieboy
Reviews.Content: I got off the plane and walk to the Termini Airport Train rode it into (beautiful ride and great seats) Termini Station Rome. I made an easy walk to the Hotel. You get so acquainted with the community this way, Don't have a lot of bags or you will want to take a taxi. I always pack light. Greeted by a Friendly staff, I went to my room, it was clean and restful. I always like a nice bathroom and this one was large and clean. The cost was good. I was close to the Metro only a short distance and you are at the Coliseum. I am a walker and like to take in the sights and side streets and little stores and markets. The hotel has a great continental breakfast which got me off to a strong start each day. On the roof is a garden court where you can sit and relax. I'm so busy with the things to see in Rome I spend little amounts of time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: katekotz
Reviews.Content: This hotel had rather large rooms for European standards. It was very clean, very private and the staff was helpful. Good location, close to Termini and only a 15 minute walk to the center of the city. Good restaurants nearby, lots to choose from. We stayed for 5 nights and had no complaints. The cleaning service checked in every day to see if we wanted our room cleaned, fresh towels, etc. We were able to get internet (Wi-Fi) for the full five days for only 5 Euro total. Reception desk was helpful and gave us timely wake up calls and taxi service for the day we left, to go to the airport for 40 Euro. Would recommend highly to anyone. My fifth time visiting Rome and it was amongst the top hotels I've stayed in. Thanks for a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thin walls, but clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte B
Reviews.Content: This place was convenient to the Rome Termini. The area is alright but is close to the Termini which is a rather dodgy area. The service was alright and had an elevator. Cheap Internet, 5Euros for 3 days. The room was clean and the bathroom was modern with a good shower. There were two main problems with this hotel, firstly the walls were VERY thin. We could hear people coming and going and just generally being in their rooms, was very annoying as we felt like we couldn't talk, at one stage a room next to us, banged on the wall because we were talking to loud, but it was just normal level of speech. The other downfall was the bed. It was two singles pushed together and they were different heights, which annoyed me a lot. There are a lot of good reviews about this hotel, however we wondered what everyone was talking about, as we had no view whatsoever, we could not open the window at all, also the TV was a small non flat screen. On the plus side the hotel was very cheap and close to some awesome food places.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: Marina R
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hostel des Artistes in Rome was really enjoyable & I was quite impressed by the standard of the accommodation, especially compared to some of the other hostels in the same price range. The staff are friendly, helpful & welcoming & are happy to assist. You can check in at anytime, as they are open 24/7 & can store your luggage if you check in before 15h00. A breakfast is available for €1.50 downstairs at the restaurant next door. What really impressed me was the cleanliness of the hostel, especially the bathrooms & dorm rooms, as well as how everything was basic yet in working order. They also have hairdryers in the bathrooms, which is very handy for ladies. Our dorm room (a 3-bed one) was huge & the beds comfy. Regarding location, this place is ideal, as it is literally a 5min walk to Termini station & easily accessible to walk to other sights. A grocery store is around the corner & the street is relatively quiet at night. Overall a great experience & I would recommend this place to anyone wanting value for money in Rome, looking to enjoy their stay - it truly is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay close to termini station”
Reviews.Author: ev_mine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is divided in two separete buildings but this is not something to bother you. The reception is on the 5th floor and we got an access card for the 2nd building and the room. Our room was small but very nice and convenient with excellent en suite bathroom the room was cleaned every day and they brought us supplies (towels, soap..) the staff is very helpfull and pleasant and with no problem to communicate in english The underground station is very close even thought the termini station is only 5 minutes walk. From the termini you can catch the second line of the undderground or bus to almost everywhere we highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty ok, no major problems”
Reviews.Author: GiaFH
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated quite good, you are within walking distance from pretty much everything, and it is easy to reach since the central railwaystation Termini is close. Also the subway station is close if you prefer to use public transportation instead. The hotel itself is divided in to (at least) to different building so you might need to find yourself first up to the 5th floor reception and get down to walk some few meters to the next building to reach your room. Elevators are very small and our light-weighted, small travelpram for the baby fitted in them just and just. The back pack however didn't anymore with the pram. The hotel is clean, rooms are spacious and ok, and the service is ok. Continental breakfast offers enough options to get your stomach satisfied. It's not a luxury hotel, but then again, that you didn't except did you? Would recommend this on this star range hotels. There is quite a horrible restaurant close by called Quattro Stagioni that you should avoid, but a great one called Donati that is to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, close to Termini”
Reviews.Author: marlette
Reviews.Content: This hotel, within few blocks of Termini was lovely. Very generous room, nice bathroom and lovely hotel staff. It is within walking [towing wheeled suitcase] distance from Termini and there are a number of wonderful restaurants in a 3 block radius. Would highly recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Handy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Liz J
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel as a group of 4 ladies - all in one quite comfortable room.(The 4 single beds in a row were like something out of Snow White!). We were peasantly surprised by the quality of the room. Linen and towels were changed daily, the room was spotless, and there was enough room for our clothes. It was a mixture of floors - ground floor for entrance, first floor for breakfast, third floor for our room, fifth floor for reception, with a roof top area for chilling with drinks purchased from the fridge in reception. The inbetween floors belonged to another hotel or two.Odd, but the little lift made light weather of it. Breakfast was OK, but we would have welcomed some fresh fruit alongside the tinned variety. But the good part was the location. A short walk from the railway station,(Termini), where all the buses, trains and tours started from. Also there were lots of restauants within strolling distance, all with good quality, cheap food. Being on a side road there was no traffic noise. Recommend this hotel for a bargain stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: julielevoir l
Reviews.Content: This is such a comfortable and friendly place to stay. On reception, 5th floor, everyone helpful. Stayed in the budget accommodation room on the 5 th floor. Bed very comfortable and so very clean. Quiet as well. The walk from the train station was not a problem as lots of people of all ages, out and about at night. Ceiling fan kept the room cool. Bar opposite the hotel was friendly and sold milk for our breakfast the next morning.Could have used a voucher for another cafe round the corner. Washbasin in the room and large bathrooms that we never had to wait for.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: FriendlyTourist58
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was helpful to arrange early am taxi--really early! for a 6:30 am flight. took away our worries on this regard.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good with only a few let downs!”
Reviews.Author: kiwideni
Reviews.Content: Location is great, very close to Termini station, lots of cafee, restaurants, supermarkets and only about 20 mins walk to the Colosseum through the wonderful streets of Rome. Our check in wasn't so great though. We arrived after 2pm and were asked to leave our bags on the ground floor- the reception is on the 5th floor in a very old elevator.At reception there were 3 receptionists there checking in a group of teenage boys...I think the hotel is part hostel as well? Anyway we were asked to sit in the little living room area so they could process these guys first...ok that was fine..but about 20 minutes later i got sick of waiting.The guy behind the desk had some kind of attitude and asked for our passports etc even though he knew our bags were downstairs...couldn't they have asked us to get them while we we waiting? Check in took forever..Just poor customer service i think.. Anyway the room was quite nice, we had a double bed and a single bed and it was still quite spacious.There was a sink in the room and our room overlooked the courtyard so it was nice and quiet. A weird thing about the room is that you get a room key and another little key that you put into a hole near the door for the electricity and such, when you put this key in a red light turns on outside your door to show that you are in the room.....opportunity for someone to rob you when they notice the light is not on?? We left that key in there while we were out, so that the light was constantly on. The bathrooms were never in use when we needed them and they are quite clean. There is also a nice rooftop terrace where you can relax after a long day in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for the best price.”
Reviews.Author: Melinda54
Reviews.Content: When I first saw I didn't like it much.There is no impressive entrance and there is always a problem with the elevator but it proved to be excellent. The rooms are always clean,they are spacious and beautifully decorated. Breakfast has a lot to choose and most importantly everyone who is working there is more than friendly,very helpful and very polite...It is a very cheap hotel considered what it offers!!You must go!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like our home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Stahl_D
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay (last visit was in 2008 for 1 night). Location is great for getting around Rome. The rooms in Carlitos Way are large, well appointed (loved the small fridge) and quiet. Breakfast is excellent. Staff are super friendly and helpful. I would weigh their dinning recommendations for lunch/dinner carefully. Overall feel this place is great value. Have stayed near the Vatican also, while that is a nice neighborhood - the location of Hotel des Artisites is much better for accessing the Metro, buses and, trains from TermIni. There are two supermarkets nearby (love that room fridge) and an excellent little wine bar. When I go back to Rome, I am staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good value near station”
Reviews.Author: toma348
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean and comfortable, 10 min. walk from Termini train station and metro. No free internet in room, no coffee making facilities. No breakfast, but bars and restaurants very close.

Reviews.Title: “Large, pleasant room, clean, and a nice bathroom.”
Reviews.Author: Bctbct
Reviews.Content: Des Artistes has a youth hostel as well as a hotel - don't get them mixed up! We were initially taken aback by the number of kids with backpacks at the check-in desk and thought we had made a terrible mistake, but it turned out to be fine. There is not much atmosphere to the hotel per se, as the check-in is on the 5th floor and our room was on the 3rd floor, so we would come into the building and go directly to our room, but the room was nice and the street quiet. They give out discount cards for an internet place (the hotel's didn't work with my Android) and a chit for a cappucino and croissant breakfast around the corner for 1.5 Euros. (The hotel does offer a breakfast but it's 8 Euros extra) There's also a good restaurant a few doors down - the Three Arches - with a nice outdoor dining spot.. It's easy walking distance to the train station, which is where the Metro and many busses have stops. So it's not glamorous, but it's comfortable and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: DaveThePubsinger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rome Des Artistes hotel for 10 days in June 2011. Our booking was for a double ensuite room and included breakfast. Our room was situated on the 4th floor. It was a good size, nicely decorated and had sufficient drawer/hanging space for our needs. There was a large comfortable doublebed, good air conditioning, a small electronic safe and a mini-fridge which was useful for keeping our water cool. The TV had 2 English channels (BBC World and CNN international). The bathroom was small but clean and modern and consisted of a (good) shower, toilet, washbasin and bidet. We did not use the hairdryer or heated towel rail. Rooms were cleaned daily (by a friendly cleaning-lady) and towels, shower gel, soap and bath-hat were replenished if necessary. There were no in-room coffee-making facilities. The hotel itself was a 5 storey building (one lift), with reception (24 hour) located on the 5th floor. Reception staff were helpful and knowledgeable. Check-in was from 14:00 and check out time was at 10:30am though there was a (locked) luggage store on the ground floor which was available as required. The roof terrace was very pleasant (and you could take your own food and drink there) but provided views into other hotels rooms rather over the rooftops of Rome (as claimed by the hotel website). Breakfast (buffet) was available (from 7.30 - 10am) on the first floor with a choice of rolls, croissants, bread (feeble toaster), cakes, pastries, cereals, cold meats, cheese and a variety of spreads, yogurt, bacon, eggs, frankfurters, milk, juice and water. A coffee machine provided a variety of hot drinks and the lady in change of the area was always friendly and quick to replenish items running low. We chose this hotel because it was well-positioned close to both termini and pretoria stations (a single metro journey cost one euro). There was a supermarket (called Sigma) practically at the end of the street and a small bar (also serving food) just across the road. Our favourite bar (called The Yellow) was just one street away, served wine (decent-sized glass!) from 2 euros upwards as well as having a resaonably priced small menu and pleasant inside and outside seating areas. Overall we were very pleased with the hotel and its location and would have no hesitation in recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel close to Termini train station”
Reviews.Author: atlrefro16
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Des Artistes for a girls trip to Rome in early June. We booked through EuropeanDestinations.com, and everything went smoothly. The hotel is just a few blocks (about a 10 minute walk) to Termini train station, which was very convenient. We bought the Roma Pass, so it was nice to be convenient to the Metro and bus stops at Termini. The hotel itself shares a building with several other smaller hotels (the reception desk is on 5th floor, our room was on 3rd floor). The room itself was very nice, with a flat screen TV, pretty paintings and decorative touches, a mini-fridge, closet, and safe. The bathroom was nice and clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, providing us with a map and useful transportation advice. My only complaint is that the WiFi was spotty and unreliable (which you pay a few Euros for). The breakfast was good with cappucino, assorted breads/cakes, eggs, ham, toast, cereal, etc. Overall, a great hotel for the value, close to the main transportation hubs. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Value”
Reviews.Author: JeffkVancouver
Reviews.Content: This is very nice little hotel nothing pretentious however great service from desk staff and the breakfast was wonderful surprise...the rooftop garden is a wonderful relaxing space location is near Termini station a four block walk or half a block walk from Castro Pretorio subway station on the blue line which also takes you to the coleseum

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and good service.”
Reviews.Author: resor2011
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel within walking distance from railwaystation. A calm area and located just by the Metro, so you reach any place in Rome within minutes. We were all very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: xs-may
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, about 10min walk from the main train station, Termini which you can get to for 8euro from the airport. It is reasonably easy to find from there if you have a map. We stayed in a private double room, with an en-suite which was clean and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast had plenty of variety which was included in the package we found. The staff were very helpful when they could be and spoke very good english so were able to make recommendations and give us directions. Overall it was very good quality for what we paid, and it was more than adequate for a short stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “5 star accomodation, 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: JoanaToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel when we booked the flight through expedia.ca; we read the reviews but never thought that the hotel is beyond expectations; the personnel helped us in everything we needed; absolutely fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MartyVV
Reviews.Content: Great Stay. Hotel was central so great for seeing the sites. The room was clean, had lots of closet space, nicely decorated and it had a great new bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, very clean, friendly environment, good price!”
Reviews.Author: Anda0105
Reviews.Content: The service is great, when we arrived there everything was set, they gave us the key right away and took us to our room (I was with my boyfriend). The room looked A LOT smaller than you can see in their pictures (there was no table, just a chair near the closer) but I think it's because we got the cheapest solution for two persons(students) -double room, without breakfast. But despite the initial feeling of smallness, it was very comfy and clean. The bed is awesome, you have a TV, air conditioned, phone and hair dryer. Very nice, and I would recommend it to anyone :D

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for price, good location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Kohitsuji_chan
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend in Rome with my friend and we chose this hotel beecause it was cheap and close to Termini station. We had a clean and nicely funrnished room on 4th floor. Towels were changed daily, the bathroom was as well equipped with a hair dryer, ab idet, big mirrors and shampoo/shower gel. We didn't book with breakfast, but there are many places in walking distance. Staff was friendly and helpful. This hotel is ideal if you want to combine low budget with comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place for our group pilgrimage.”
Reviews.Author: Shinerama
Reviews.Content: I took a student group to Rome a few weeks ago and we stayed at the Hotel des Artistes. Our rooms were in the "Annex" next door. All of our rooms were exceptionally clean and well-appointed. Bathroom was nice. Wireless internet for 10 euros per week was great and overall very reliable and, in the end, they didn't charge us for it. The young, mostly bi-lingual staff was extremely helpful and eager to please. Breakfast was fine, though the coffee/cappuccino machine was the worst. Happily, the little "bar" across the street (the blue neon out front makes it look sketchy, but walk inside and it's a nice neighborhood shop) had great espresso and cappuccino, so no worries. The rooftop terrace was a real treat after long days of walking. We walked through the neighborhood at all hours and always felt safe. Easy access to Termini meant that our day trips to Pompeii and Assisi were practically effortless, and the public transportation options from the hotel were easy to learn and use. Now, if you're big on watching TV or need lots of amenities, this might not be the place for you. But I'd very happily return and will recommend the hotel to others. The whole city of Rome is, of course, spectacular and it's almost impossible to find bad food or ugly places. The further you are from the super-touristy areas, the cheaper and often better the food is. The little neighborhood pizzerias and restaurants near des Artistes were all surprisingly good and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location.. helpfull staff ... clean hotel.. perfect location !!”
Reviews.Author: piskas
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the termini train station which is an asset if you want to take the easy way instead of walking around rome... the hotel staff were very helpful and they can speak different languages... the cleanliness of the room was spot on, the room was medium size but it was enough for two people with 2 luggages... an advantage that this hotel is open 24hrs a day.. price range for 4 days it was worth it who is on a budget holiday... definately would recommend this hotel if we would consider visiting rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Worked out great for us!”
Reviews.Author: Henrietta_Stackpole
Reviews.Content: We only stayed on night here. I chose this hotel because it's distance (about five blocks) from Termini station, where we caught a morning express train to the airport. I paid a special advance price of about $105 for a non-refundable double room that didn't include breakfast. I'd say this was a decent value as Rome is an expensive town. The two men working in the lobby were polite and helpful. They even let me print our our boarding passes for our next morning's flight. I heard them speaking Italian, English, Spanish and French in the short time I was in the lobby and was impressed. The room itself was clean with a comfortable bed and a hot shower. I can't say the location was the most beautiful part of Rome, but it was certainly convenient and there's a lot of pizza shops in the area. I paid 1 euro for an hour of wifi--I'd recommend the hotel offer free wifi to it's guests.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing breakfast and help from the staff.”
Reviews.Author: Disappointed32283
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was a disappointment for the cost of the room, internet access was only available at one desk in the loby and you were charged over $10.00 for 15 min. The staff were unfriendly and not particularly helpful. We were awakened at midnight by extremely loud music and talking which lasted until 4:00 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephiedawn
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect location right next to Termini Station. The rooms were very clean and perfect for what I needed them for and that was sleep and getting ready in the morning. The beds were a little on the hard side and i can see how that might bother some people but i was so tired from my days out i didn't even notice. The breakfast was good too, a lot of variety. We got to Rome pretty early in the morning and couldn't check in for a few hours but we were able to leave our luggage there and walk around while we waited. The staff was always able to answer our questions and were very straight forward with the answers. I would stay there again the next time i go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Deva2u
Reviews.Content: My sister, friend and I were happy with Hotel des Artistes. We were there to sleep and shower so it worked for us. It was an average hotel with average amenities. We have no complaints. The room was clean which is very important and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location was great as it is a 10 minute walk to the Termini Station should you need to travel to another city (which we did) and there is a train stop around the corner that will take you into the various parts of the city. For the price I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great price, nice room especially if you are travelling with teens/kids”
Reviews.Author: Safariranger
Reviews.Content: We needed a quad room in Rome, which seems to be a difficult thing to find. This hotel is very close to the train station, had large, clean, quiet rooms and a great price. The room was spacious, bathroom well equiped. Breakfast was very good and ample. There were many restaurants in walking distance and two other small hotels on our quiet side street. The staff was very helpful in providing directions to sites and suggesting restaurants. We chose the Fodor's recommendation, Rossopomodoro for dinner one night. It was amazing pizza and the desserts were to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: andreaspica
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel des Artistes. The included breakfast was better then most with hot eggs as well as hard boiled. Lots of breads and coffees to choose from. The hotel is just off a Metro stop so between that and walking you can really get wherever you need to go in Central Rome. Lots of great, local restaurants nearby - very neighborhood like and quiet. The staff was particularly friendly and helpful with a great command of English.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean, friendly, and basic”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerWinchester
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff, well-managed and clean. Spacious rooms in separate building called Nice Hotel with two rather hostel-like but very clean and basic bathrooms. .

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and very helpful in reception”
Reviews.Author: lexthelunatic
Reviews.Content: couldnt complain about this hotel to be honest and its less than 5 minutes walk from terminni station.receptionist are very friendly and helpful,rooms are very clean tidy cleaners were in everyday cleaning room and changing towels and in other hotels iv been its been extra charges to change towels.didnt eat in the hotel as no restraunt and i didnt pay for the breakfast but i would definatly reccomend this hoel as i did alot of research on hotels in rome and for the price i payed for this i wuldnt av egot any better hotel unless i was prepared to pay double the price

Reviews.Title: “Not Great!”
Reviews.Author: firenze18
Reviews.Content: This place really doesn't deserve some of the excellent reviews on here! On arrival we were taken to our room which was up the street in a completely different apartment block. Inside the front door we were faced with the communal bins for the block which was pretty horrible. When we got to our room it was still dirty and the receptionist left us there and wondered off for about 15mins before deciding that we had to wait till later for our room. The room was basic, the internet access was advertised as free but we were told we had to pay and the bed was so so hard. this place is not great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay for a short weekend break”
Reviews.Author: OwenSetter
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews of this hotel on TripAdvisor, we were prepared for having difficulties in finding the hotel. However, we had no problems whatsoever, and found the hotel with ease. On check in, we found the concierge to be extremely polite and helpful. He immediately offered us a map of the city, and advised us that if we had any queries on where to go, etc he'd be more than happy to give us some advise. After the standard check in procedures, one of his colleagues guided us to our room... he led us back out of the hotel, and back up the street.... we were confused at this point, but the chap was very kindly carrying our bags, so were not too concerned. He lead us to another door, and up two flights of stairs (elevator optional) to a lovely little room in the building which was basically adjacent to where we checked in. Being seperated off like this was superb, our small room felt more like a bedsit apartment, and so we were not worried at all about arriving back late, or worrying about having to leave room keys at reception, we really were able to run our own schedule and enjoy our weekend without problem, The room was characterful, and comfortable. Having stayed at Travelodge Heathrow the previous night, this was a great treat. The room was small- something I've become expectant on when staying in Italian hotels, but was decorated charmingly, and had some choice pieces of art on the walls. The bathroom had a glorious shower, and was exceptionally clean. The bed was superb! Very firm, and very comfortable. The biggest surprise came on our first morning when we woke up at 10am, in a still pitch black, silent room! The shutters and curtains made for a perfect night's sleep. In terms of location, the hotel is literally a 5 minute walk from Termini. This is perfect for a 2 night stay. We left the hotel at leisure in the morning, stopped for some breakfast across the road, and were able to walk down to Termini where we could get the Metro to any stop, a bus to any location or as we did on day one- the City Sightseeing bus around the city. I really couldn't recommend a trip to Rome high enough, and Hotel Des Artistes is a big part of the reasoning for that.

Reviews.Title: “SO CLEAN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon1986
Reviews.Content: Rome is awesome!!! And this hostel only made it even better. 2 blocks from the train station, walking distance to all tourist attractions, and SO CLEAN!! The cleaning staff are literally cleaning all days and all night. One day we walked into our room and they were taking down the curtains to wash them. But aside from the spotlessness, the staff is also incredibly helpful. They will give you information about anything you need. There is a rooftop terrace which was perfect to eat supper and smoke on. There is a grocery store half a block away, and although there is no kitchen, there is a fridge where you can keep food (or beer!). I would definitely recommend this hostel to anyone staying in rome. Best city and best hostel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love the rooftop garden”
Reviews.Author: Daizita
Reviews.Content: Stayed here our last night in Rome due to the proximity to the Terminii . Lorenzo and Dmitri were wonderful. Lorenzo patiently helped us print our boarding passes when we could not access our info. Dmitri was friendly and informative about the neighborhood. We booked a small, clean and quiet double room. Dmitri told us to check out the sixth floor rooftop garden--we loved it and spent our last evening there, drinking wine and talking. It's divided into 4 spacious sections with chairs and taables, potted plants, and was wonderfully breezy. The moon and stars were gorgeous; what a great way to say goodbye to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: artisticlcy
Reviews.Content: After a short walk from the train station (10-15 minutes) we arrived to a friendly and helpful staff who showed us to our room that had a separate entrance next door. It had a tiny elevator but that is typical in Italy. The rooms were luxuriously furnished. Not large, but comforatble. The bathroom was spotless, and beautiful. I am very particular about cleanliness but found this place a treat. The bed was comfortable. The only complaint is the noise from the bars across the street. Closing the window cut out the noise but also the air flow. It got very hot, even in May. Apparently there is air conditioning but we didn't bother. Breakfast was okay. I think we meant to book the hostel part of the hotel but I'm glad we didn't. I can't say what it's like in that part but I really enjoyed my stay in the hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel,good service,close to transportation.”
Reviews.Author: SergeBkln
Reviews.Content: It is located off the most famous historical and cultural sights.If you walk-40-60 min to Colosseum or Fontana Di Trevi.5 min to subway (cheap,1EU),10 min from train station (15EU express to airport).There are restaurants (one across) and supermarkets close to hotel. Room was big and nice,big bathroom,shower bigger than usual in budget Europe hotels,AC with remote,TV,digital safe,cleaning and fresh towels every day. Breakfast was good,buffet with eggs,bacon,few choices of ham and cheese,cruassans,jam,butter,cake,cereal with plain yogurt,juice,coffee,tea etc.7.30 til 9. There is terrace on the roof,you may bring own wine and food or buy it from the bar at the last floor,after hours guy from bar hangs downstairs by refrigerator with drinks that he sells.I'd seen people on terrace at night with wine glasses,I think you may borrow them at the bar (since nobody was there I just did without asking-it is open overnight and has wending machines either). WiFi is EU10 for a whole stay-I put it as "Free".

Reviews.Title: “exciting experience :::.......”
Reviews.Author: willy080
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and organized, the rooms are very clean, breakfast not included but in front there is a great bar, with all the comforts a traveler for all boys and girls are cute, and at night you can have fun and meet People from all over the world, first place in Rome where you can feel good and confident that nothing happens dangerous. The reception staff were friendly and provide information at any time. Advice to all who want to have fun and spend moments of happiness to come here

Reviews.Title: “Family with young child great stay at Des Artistes”
Reviews.Author: Ina069
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel perfectly adequate, very homely and welcoming. It had everything we needed. Including free internet. Breakfast was fine with a good variety of food and we had the breakfast on the terrace on top roof. Fantastic! Couldn't`t been better. The elevator is small but works well. The position of the hotel, a short walk from the Termini Station, absolutely could not have been better. There are even some very good restaurants near by. The room was very nice and clean, modern bathroom, good air conditioned and big enough for the three of us. The staff was very professional but on a personal level, very friendly and helpful. And the best of all they all speak English. They made our stay in Rome a pleasant memory. Thank you! The area around the hotel was nice and quite. We will definitely stay there again. Hotel Des Artistes deserve those 3 stars and a bit more. Highly recommended!! Ina Tibre, Sweden, Aug 2010

Reviews.Title: “Crap hotel, even crappier location, AVOID. DONT STAY HERE IF YOU WANT TO SLEEP.”
Reviews.Author: Jill-02-07
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel, believing that I was checking in for the hotel next door, Lucci Hotel which was quite pricey, however was told that I would be staying in this hotel and not the Lucci (once they demanded payment in full before seeing the room) I wasnt happy as it didnt look the best, I voiced my complaints but it fell on deaf ears, got to the twin room on the 4th floor (room 405) it was cramped, beds were almost on top of each other, it was painted a horrible dull blue...The worst was yet to come that night & EVERY night the bar across the road was so loud we couldnt sleep, very loud music and when youve been on ur feet all day all u want to do is sleep at night, impossible at this hotel...Even with earplugs in I could hear the music! There is airconditioning in the room but ONLY if you pay €15 a night for it! Absolutely ridiculous with the price I had paid...The bathroom is tiny & cramped, the shower water was was too hot and couldnt be cooled down! There was only 2 of us (women) and we had to drag our luggage, 4 cases, up the stairs ourselves while the "gentlemen" at the desk sat looking at us, same with storing our luggage on check out day, we had to drag our cases down stairs to be locked in a room drag them back up then down to reception again, while they all looked on. NOT A BIT NICE. Breakfast was BRUTAL...tea/coffee was absolute DIRT, water wasnt even hot, there was croissants/rolls but all was covered in icing sugar. there was sausages & scrambled eggs but dont bother eating them unless you like them STONE COLD. Only 3 choices of cereal horrible cornflakes, coco pop type & muesli, natural yoghurt & TINNED fruit NO FRESH FRUIT...Dont waste ur time even going for breakfast, I know we werent the only 1's complaining, many of the other guests were giving out! Location, this is NOWHERE near Termini Station, it's a good 10 minute walk through a rough enough area... I would NEVER recommend this hotel to ANYONE! As far as we were concerned they took our money & that was it

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: devoncpl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked a last minute trip to Rome to escape the dismal English summer and were on a very limited budget so did a lot of searching to find a decent low budget hotel and came across Des Artistes on expedia. Since it was only just over 50 euros per night for the room and breakfast we weren't expecting too much. But boy were we in for a surprise! First of all the hotel is very easy to find being less than a ten minute walk from the main Termini rail and bus station where the bus from the airport drops you off (slight deviation here - if you are on a budget don't bother getting the train from Leonardo Da Vinci airport as the shuttle bus is half the price and we found it to be perfectly adequate and took about 35-40 minutes which is not much longer than the train). Upon entering the hotel we found the reception staff very friendly and helpful and the check-in process was completed in about ten minutes. The reception area itself, although quite small is inviting, relaxed and cool - a welcome relief from the heat outside which, during our visit was around 35deg celsius (98deg fahrenheit)! We were told tha the reception is open 24/7 so there is always someone there to help with any questions. We were then directed to our room using the quietest lift I have ever been in! We were on the third floor (room 311) and when we entered we could not believe that this hotel does not have an extra star or two. OK, the room wasn't the biggest we've ever stayed in but certainly not the smallest (by a looong way!) and was spotless and tastefully decorated. The refridgerator was a nice touch although I thought it could be a little larger. There was perfectly adequate hanging space and our luggage also fitted into the wardrobe. The bathroom was also spotless and very well fitted out. There have been comments on here about the size of the shower and, yes, it is on the small side. In our room it was in the corner of the bathroom and had a curved front rather that square sides. This did make it a little cramped but having said that it was not really a problem and although I am not the worlds largest person (180lbs 5'6") I didn't find it too much of an inconvenience. On the plus side there was never an issue with hot water and the pressure was just fine. The bed itself was large and dominated the room. I like quite a firm matress and I was not dissapointed and both myself and my partner slept very well. The room was quiet although we were at the rear of the hotel which overlooks a small courtyard bounded by hotels and residential appartments. It is possible that the rooms at the front could be noisier on account of the bar across the street so if you can, ask for a room at the rear. The room was fitted with an air conditioning unit but we never turned it on and despite the heat had no problem getting to sleep with the window open and the shutters closed. I believe (although I haven't confirmed this) that there is an extra charge for the air conditioning of something like 5 euros. Like I said, we didn't use it so can't comment on its effectiveness. The breakfast room must have been extended if previous comments are anything to go by because it was perfectly adequate, being in three seperate joining open-plan type rooms. Once again the room was nicely decorated and spotless. Breakfast itself was great: an all-you-can-eat buffet style - when I say all-you-can-eat that we were never told that but we had as much as we wanted and never got any dissaproving looks ;-) There was bread, pastries, hard boiled eggs, cold meats, cheese, three types of cereal, yoghurt, fruit juice (this was from powder mix and was the only "slight" dissapointment), tea, coffee (normal and esspresso) and hot chocolate. All-in-all we thought that Des Artistes represented outstanding value for money and would be hard pressed to find any negative things to say about it. If we were being picky we would probably say that the refridgerator in the room could have been larger (the cabinet it was in was certainly able to house one twice the size) and there could have been "real" fruit juice at breakfast. One of the really nice things about this hotel is the roof terrace which was great for relaxing on after a hard day sight-seeing and the hotel are fine with you bringing your own food to eat in the evening - once again the roof terrace is ideal for this. In terms of getting around the city there is a Metro stop about a five minute walk away and, as previously stated, the main station is about ten minutes. If you visit Vatican City (highly recommended by the way) you will need to get a cab or a #40 bus as there is no convenient metro. Everything else is pretty much in walking distance - it took us about half an hour gentle walk to reach the Coluseum. We found the red "official" hop-on-hop-off tour bus to be a great way of getting around and at 18 euros for 48 hours (timed from when you first use your ticket) was pretty good value also. So if you are looking for a great budget hotel for a short break in Rome you really couldn't do better than Des Artistes. We will certainly stay there again when we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and comfort after a day exploring beautiful Rome”
Reviews.Author: sarahmichelledec
Reviews.Content: On arrival/Location: We found it very easy to find as I'd got instructions from the hotel itself and google maps. It's a 5 minute walk from the Termini Station (perfect location, never get lost as there's always a tube train or bus going there!) and was perfect considering this was our first holiday without adults. When we arrived the staff were very friendly. They gave us a map of the city and pinpointed some tourist hotspots including a popular icecream parlour (but as you explore the city you find your own favourite places). There's an old rickety style lift to take you up to your floor which was crucial after walking all day but it isn't a big hotel so wouldn't have been hard to get to our room via the stairs, we were just lazy! Room: I booked this hotel based on the reviews and prices. There are three types of room available: shared bedrooms and bathrooms, private room with a shared bathroom and private en suite rooms. We went with the private rooms with a shared bathroom as I decided we'd be spending most of the day away from the hotel and we saved a lot of money. The room was traditionally decorated, not to my personal taste but was fitting for the holiday! it came with a T.V. and sink so we did not have to queue to brush our teeth. The room was cleaned every day and the bathrooms were also cleaned daily. They were abit messy towards the end of the day but only because it was high time for showers so the floor was quite soggy. Occassionally we had to queue but there is about 3 bathrooms on our floor so we just used one of the others. Can't complain about the room or bathrooms at all; for the money we saved it was brilliant and the room was great to come back to for a rest before finding somewhere to eat. It got a bit hot though as there was only a ceiling fan and no air con but it was bearable. This was the perfect hotel for a young couple's first holiday. It was basic but very homely too. I didn't feel homesick and felt safe too. I had some qualms as i read that some areas around the Termini station were rough but this area was fine. Near to many resteraunts, pizza bars, cafes, a bank, an internet cafe and a laundrette so we did not have to walk far for anything. The only thing I missed was a cup of tea before bed!

Reviews.Title: “Such a friendly and warm hotel”
Reviews.Author: erginuk
Reviews.Content: Such a friendly and warm hotel. We really enjoyed our staying at Hotel des Artistes. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Keep up the good work. Next time I visit to Rome, I will definately stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: suaterus
Reviews.Content: We stay for 5 days in our honeymoon. We used the room only for sleeping. Hotel was very clean, staff was very nice. Hotel is near the main terminal (Termini) and this is an advantage for tripping Rome. Breakfast salon was very little but the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great wonderful experience here!”
Reviews.Author: Skynet2010
Reviews.Content: We had a delightful experience here,the staff are wonderful,location excellent,metro station very close and the breakfast buffet was too good!

Reviews.Title: “Decent low budget hotel, but wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Jamie022
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, not a great location, but staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel des Artistes has become even better since our last stay there”
Reviews.Author: 7799traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in 2004 and liked it very much. On our last trip in June 2010 we were happy to see that hotel has become even better. They made wonderful improvements to the rooms, and breakfast has more variety. The rooms are very clean and the service is excellent. The reception area people are very knowledgeble and helpful. The place has a feel of a good 4 star hotel. I would definately stay there again on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect to be able to sleep at this hotel - it is upstairs from a noisy bar.”
Reviews.Author: kwdc
Reviews.Content: There is a bar across the street from this hotel. When I stayed, people were at the bar, outside, in the street, shouting, laughing, and making so much noise that I could not sleep until they left at 4am. Also, as my room was not air conditioned, I had no option but to leave the window wide open to get any air circulation at all. This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. Do not stay here unless you, too, plan to be up until 4am every night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for young travellers”
Reviews.Author: BindiB
Reviews.Content: We were a party of mostly teenagers visiting Rome and we stayed at Des Artistes. Really good value for money, very clean and the rooms were always neatly tidied. The breakfast was really good, providing a wide range of continental foods for everyone - cooked, cereal, toast, meats, cheese, yoghurt, fruit. Excellent location as it was close to the metro, 10 minutes from termini and 15 from Repubblica by walking distance. Lots of small italian restaurants nearby which were really good for when we were tired and wanted to eat locally. Good bus links as well - bus stop on the main road had buses that went to piazza navona and campo de fiori that couldn't be reached by metro. The hotel staff were the most friendly and most knowledgable we have come across. They were very helpful when we enquired for a number of things such as good fish restaurants, the price of taxis to the vatican and bus routes throughout the city, they knew all the answers. The hotel also has a really nice roof terrace where you can eat pre-bought food or take-out pizzas. Overall, a really enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “re: Best Value in Rome - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RomaViaggiatoreUSA
Reviews.Content: Hotel des Artistes may be the best hotel in Rome for tourists considering it's location, cost, and the professional and courteous demeanor of the owners, managers and staff. Over many years I have stayed in the hostel, the simple rooms, and the beautiful, more ornate air-conditioned rooms. Hotel des Artistes offers excellent value, service and comfort at each of it's levels, beyond compare to other Roman hotels, especially in the Roma Termini zone. It is only a five-minute walk from the train station in a very safe district, hence it's popularity for the young, and for families. The staff are poly-lingual and always prepared to help in so many situations. The hotel rooms are very clean and quiet, and the hostel is probably one of the best in all of Italy - fun for young people, but not a noisy party environment. I recommend highly Hotel des Artistes and it's sister hotels. WJL/Italia/USA

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel ratio price/ quality”
Reviews.Author: bresciani
Reviews.Content: Hi , just came back from Rome and need to say that we loved our stay at this hotel. The hotel is clean and staff are friendly and very helpful. The breakfast is good. ( eggs, toast, croissant, yogurt, cheese, meat) . The hotel is very weel situated near a metro ( 2 minutes walking). And 10 minutes from termini station ( main metro station and train station). You have a lot a little restaurant near the hotel and a very nice terrasse on the roof. You can buy a pizza take out and go to the terrasse to eat. No noise. except for the birds in the morning. Excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: mgaivao
Reviews.Content: The staff of the hotel is extremely efficient and very friendly and helpful, always ready to give you a hand on anything you might need. The location, close to the Termini Station is great as a starting point to discover Rome on foot

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: Buckeyetraveler59
Reviews.Content: My family which includes a 15 year old and 19 year old and I just returned from a great trip to Rome. We liked staying at this hotel.I don't usually write reviews but this hotel worked well for us. It is close to a Metro stop less than a block away. The breakfast is quite nice in a nice clean room. There is a nice terrace at the top of the building if you have any time to relax. You can find pizza around the corner on the way to the Metro stop so even though you are a good distance from many of the sights it is quite easy to get to them. We were able to get a room with a double bed and two singles which is not easy in Europe. It was quiet at night. The staff is very helpful. I was very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet, close to train station”
Reviews.Author: SilkSpectreV
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights in des Artistes. We had a triple room, which looked pretty much like the official photos on the site. Both the room and the bathroom were tasteful and cleaned well every day. We paid €161 per night. The hotel is about 10 minutes' walk from Termini station. When you arrive at the station from the airport, walk along platform 25 to the other end of the station. It is a nicer walk inside the station than outside. Our room overlooked Via Villafranca, but the double-glazing did wonders and there was absolutely no noise coming in from outside. The AC was a little loud, though. Breakfast was a simple fair with a choice of plain youghurt, muesli, canned fruit, bread roll, sweet pastry, etc. It is worth taking your breakfast up onto the 6th floor where the terrace is although it is not quite as lush as in the photos on this site. It has to be said that the coffee is terrible though, so don't bother. Overall, we were very pleased with the hotel although would probably check if we could get the same quality accommodation slightly cheaper next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: katrinqm
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel is wonderful! The hotel staff are extremely helpful and knowledgeable, especially Joseph, who explained us public transport system,gave us sightseeing tips, and made us feel really welcomed The rooms were comfortable and clean, and the location was great!The breakfast was warm, good, and plentiful! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: sunburnt_curt
Reviews.Content: If I was travelling with my wife I would never stay here. However, when I stayed here I was travelling with my 14-year-old son on a 10-day, 10+ country barnstorming tour of Europe with only small backpacks for our stuff. One step above camping is all we needed. This hotel is certainly much better than camping. It seemed reasonably clean (for us, at least) and the location can't be beat if all you want is fast and easy access to transportation to everywhere. There's a small grocery, pharmacy, and little place you can buy coffee and pastries just a couple blocks away. There are numerous restaurants in the area although we only ate at one. Met some gentleman from Sweden and had a fine time. Here's a weird thing - after we checked in, the woman at the desk walked us to our room. We went out the door we came in and walked about 25 yards down the sidewalk to another door. She slid our plastic key through the reader and then walked through a hallway with three garbage cans (small and never smelled). We took the stairs rather than the elevator up two floors. We got to the second floor landing and we went through another door. And then we went through one more door into our room. My son and I thought this was so ridiculous we took a series of photos showing how absurd it was. The windows open, which is always nice. However, if your window opens to the street, be forewarned that it can be pretty loud out there at night. There's a cafe/bar across the street and there was lot of boisterous shenanigans going on out there until past 1:00 am. On the upside, the window we had was virtually soundproof when I closed it so the guys downstairs didn't bother me. The guy at the desk, the girl who walked us to our room, and the guy I gave my key to upon checkout, were the only staff we saw during our entire two-day stay. They were all pleasant. So, luxury? No, absolutely not. Looking for well located place simply to crash after spending the day out in the hectic city that is Rome? This is your place

Reviews.Title: “This is a hostel, not a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rpanch
Reviews.Content: If I had not been told that this was a 3 star hotel, I would have thought that it was a hostel. The service was totally amateur, the rooms were very dark and the beds really old. During breakfast, we found several hairs inside our croissants, no comment. I have been in over a hundred hotels and I cannot remember a hotel as terrible as this one. The hotel is convenient only if you plan to take daily trips outside Rome (Termini train station is 5-10 minutes away). Otherwise it's quite inconvenient since the center of the city is 3-4 miles away from the hotel. For the price and quality of this hotel, I totally recommend you to stay at a pension or a hostel right in the city center instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff that cares, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: WistaWio
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and I don't have any complaints. The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is a bit worn but comfy and fairly clean. The location is not quie central, but for the price you can't expect too much. The hotel is in the vicinity of Rome's central station Termini. The area seems pretty shady, but there were no incidents even walking late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, quite good location near Termini station for the price we paid I would expect a bit more.”
Reviews.Author: xjirj18
Reviews.Content: Room very well equiped. Photos on the website equals to the reality. But this applies only for the rooms. The hotel is situated in the house which original purpose definitely was not the hotel. There is almost no reception. Breakfast room is on 5th floor. Rooftop terrace is good to spend breakfast at becuase of the morning sun but not because of the lousy equipment. Breakfast was good (white bread, toasts, ham, salami and cheese, coffee from the coffee machine) but might contain at least some fresh fruit. We were quite satisfied with our 4-night stay. The room was very nice and the location also quite good - Termini station 5 minutes walk where you could get on both metro lines or bus to reach every destination in Rome quite fast. I've never been to Rome before so I am not sure if the price for the hotel is high or not. But I have a feeling that for the money we paid (EUR 164 / night) it did not pay off. I would expect a bit more for such a money. And this is the only reason I would not recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location! Reasonable for Rome!”
Reviews.Author: SMarshall_001
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance from Termini, this hotel/ hostel provides affordable accommodation with breakfast included. The rooms are quite small, hot, and our AC did not work, however I learned that some hotels do not run their AC except in the hottest summer months. The cot I slept on was hard and not terribly comfortable, but I was so exhausted from seeing the sites in Rome that once I hit the bed, I was down for the count. The entire room and bathroom were very clean. The people at the front desk were very helpful and friendly. Unfortunately, we had to leave before breakfast which is served starting at 7:30 AM. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room in old-fashioned italian style”
Reviews.Author: N0nameneeded
Reviews.Content: We read a lot about the hotel before the arrival. Still we were pleasently surprised about the room - it was in oldfashioned italian style which made the stay in Rome even more autentic, We had a shared bathroom, actually too, which were very clean the whole time. The only thing that bothers me a little is, that I'm not sure which hotel we actually stayed in. We booked for Carlito's Way, but the building we were brought to didn't have a name on it anywhere and according to the map we got at the reception it was the Nice Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good, Excellent Base To Explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: Softtan
Reviews.Content: Very good 3* hotel, clean well appointed rooms, great rooftop terrace, very good breakfast (no eggs) but a nice assortment of cold cuts, crossiants, fresh juices, milk, toast, yougurt and cereals, easy check in/out, close to all major sites, cafes, supermarkets, restaurants and Termini train station. Our first stay at a 3* hotel, will return to Des Artistes, we choose Des Artistes because of the pics on the website and the reviews and were travelling without kids. Tips to the budget traveller, buy drinks, coke, beer, water etc at the supermarket and keep in your minibar, very cheap, also take out can be very good and cheaper if u take back to the hotel, u can eat at the rooftop terrace or in your room, we did this after long and tiring days as we experienced quite a wait in all the restaurants we sat down to eat. the train from the airport to Termini station is quite easy and only $11.00 euros per person the hotel is within walking distance, and busses are quite easy and accessible, we had allready booked tours online, so we know for next time. Beers & Wine was relatively cheap in the bars and restaurants, note very well for the seafood lover, my prawns, fish was cooked with the eyes and tail etc, so I opted for veg take out spageti and tomato sauce and mushroom pizza with red sauce, fried cheese/rice balls, really good and the hotel is simly surrounded by lots of places to eat, also 10-15% is charged on your bill (excludes take out) so be sure u look at your bill so u tip at your discression, also very good gelato, best at the Trevi Fountain, my husband went in twice, I loved the coconut and hazelnut, be prepared to see some graffiti, and be really careful crossing the streets. The sites are amazing in Rome, I wish everyone gets a chance to see it, and please ensure that you take proper walking shoes, even with flat ballerina shoes the cobble stones and uneven sidewalks will take a toll on your feet also don't get fooled or scared when u see the line up, the line up to the Vatican does not take 2 hrs although it looks it, it is a mere 20 mins or less to get through security, the line moves, take what you want from this review and totally enjoy your trip. Dianne - Canada

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel”
Reviews.Author: mwgCT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week in early-mid March, 2010, and found it to be a comfortable hotel which was a good value for money. I stayed in the main part of the hotel (as opposed to the annex). The hotel had several strong points. Rooms were large by European standards, with large bathrooms. The rooms were comfortable, tastefully decorated, with a nice window. It was quite a good value for money (in part because they offered a substantial discount for staying a full week). The staff were very friendly and very helpful. All of them spoke excellent English, and were extremely cheerful and helpful. The room was pretty quiet (I was on the 3rd floor), which, combined with a comfortable bed, meant that I slept well every night. In general there was a little bit of noise around 8-8:30 am as people headed to breakfast, and a little bit of noise around 11:30 pm or so as people came home. On the whole, it was no big deal -- I am a very light sleeper and am very sensitive to noise, and even so I really had no problems sleeping. I do have one point of caution: the location really isn't ideal. It's by no means dangerous (there are a few rough areas near Termini, but none are within 4-5 blocks of the hotel and there's a safe path from either the metro or Termini to the hotel). That said, it's not particularly charming either. The area is loaded with tourist hotels and the restaurants in the area make their money providing them with overpriced and substandard fare. Tourists will want to spend as much time as possible in other parts of the city. As noted, it's close to both Termini and the metro, but the Rome metro doesn't cover that much of the city. We spent a good bit of time walking, which wasn't too big a deal for us, but I could see it bothering some types of travelers. The breakfast (which was included with our room) was OK but nothing to write home about. On the whole, this was a reasonable priced hotel which provided comfortable rooms and good service. The trade-off is that the location is a bit inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - rooms are comfortable, walking distance to most sights, close to Termini Station.”
Reviews.Author: JackieBRS
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms - the photos on the website oversell the rooms, and we were a bit disappointed. However, the rooms are very clean and the bed was comfortable and shower good. Hotel breakfast - not great. Very basic continental breakfast and same every day. Sweet croissants were nice though. Location - 5 mins from termini station which is great for getting the bus and metro.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable with friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ces66
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family during February half term holidays and found this hotel easy to book on the internet with staff able to communicated well in English both by e-mail and in person which was very helpful as I don't speak Italian unfortunately. The four of us shared a room with an en-suite bathroom and found the hotel very clean and secure. Breakfast was a little hectic as the dining area is small but we took our food up to the roof terrace which even in winter was fine with an awning and space heater. The only things that I would complain about would be the reconstituted juice at breakfast, and being rather too warm in the bedroom - I guess Italians are used to more heat than we are in the north of England! This was a very comfortable,clean, friendly and convienient place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just a perfect Hotel/Hostel for those who want to make their visit to Rome remarkable one.”
Reviews.Author: Teomete
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a place allocated for dorms and I stayed in 4 bedded dorm. Which was just perfect. Lounge to watch TV, fridge to put your foods, daily tur down and clean up simply something you never expect from a hostel. Free space,high ceiling,good heat and the most important one real bed with no one jumping on top of you cause bed was not one on top of the other. All the staff at the reception were just perfect.Especialy a young lady who recommend me a Pizzeria on the day I checked in did very good job and she has been "a big smile lady" to me during my 4 nights stay. Hotel was very clean and very well quarded. Felt complete safe. Area has been a perfect pick for me. Metro,Bus Stop,Market,Restaurant,Termini just few minutes walk. Definetly I would prefer to stay in this Hotel again.I owe a big Thank to Hostel and Hostel Des Artistes for making my visit to Dream City ROME one of my unforgetable one. P.S. If you are a party boy/girl you can not make party in the hotel but there are dozens of bars around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable and friendly hotel, not to far from the centre of Rome, with good staff.”
Reviews.Author: blindbrian
