Reviews.Content: this is a no frills hotel, which represents very good value for a confortable stay in Rome. All the staff were friendly, the receptionists were courteous, efficient and knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location.”
Reviews.Author: HellCamino
Reviews.Content: We spent long weekend in Rome (with limited budget) and spent four nights in this hotel. First of all, our room was the cheapest one they got, so your´s might be better if you pay more. But ours was very tidy and furnished with nice materials. There was also little safe for your valuables. Bathroom was exellent! Shower, toilet, bidet (I think..?) + hair dryer as standard. Very nice tiling/mirrors. Only thing I can complain was cold floors and some noise from street, but I think that you can´t completely avoid that in old buildings at Rome. Hotel has very good location, about 10 minutes walk to Termini (main train/metro/bus station in Rome) and around corner you can find metro stop (with one stop to Termini) and little food store + pharmacy. There was also lot´s of little restaurants nearby. Service that we got from reception desk was simpy exellent! Youthful staff was ready to help on any matter we come up with. Receptionist even walked us to our room first time and gave lot´s of useful tips about the city. So big hand for that! Very good service! Breakfast was not included in our room fee, we payed for it when reserving the room. If my memory serves me right, it was about 5€/person/day. Breakfast included coffee (few varietys) juices, yoghurt, muesli, toast (the toaster was super slow, minus points for that), cold cuts, rolls etc. Very good for the money. Lady attending the breakfast did not speak a word of english, but that does not matter, she was a real character and got the job done just fine. Temperamental in good way.. You can also eat breakfast in roof one floor up if weather allows, that was nice place too. There was also a small bar, but we didn´t use it so..? Summing up: If you are regular joe with limited budget, I think this is good value hotel. Exellent service and good location! Cold floors in winter + some noise, but we´d go again!

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: kross048
Reviews.Content: The hostel is located in a hotel so security is not an issue. It was clean, had a nice common room, and had great staff at the front desk. No complaints. It is only five blocks from Termini station, and the staff were nearly fluent in English which we did not expect :).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityDolcevita
Reviews.Content: Stayed in annex of Hotel Des Artistes. Convenient location, located near Termini train station and a metro stop. Room was quite large and very clean but not great decorations.. Annex is located 2 buildings away from main hotel (where reception and breakfast are), but had secure entry into building and suite of rooms. I felt safe in the annex and never saw others there, but suspect that other hotels (and possibly hostels) also have rooms in the annex. hotel staff was mostly helpful, breakfast was ok and they have a roof deck with great views of rome. while i was there, tv did not work (was told that it was due to country switchover to digital, but not sure if i believe them)

Reviews.Title: “No frills - safe, clean base to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: rebanyc
Reviews.Content: Some of the previous reviews made me apprehensive about my existing reservation at Hotel des Artistes. As it turns out, I had nothing to be nervous about. The hotel is close to the train station which was convenient for many forms of transportation (both lines of the Metro, various buses, and most importantly for us, the train to the airport). The area is not hip but not sketchy either. There are a lot of restaurants and bars in the area by the hotel. The lobby is more that of a hostel but the halls where the rooms are were fine and our room was clean and of a decent size. Breakfast was plentiful and the rooftop terrace had many umbrellas so even though it was raining on our last morning, we were able to eat outside on the patio. Our room was on the 3rd floor and it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: hotelharpy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week at the end of October and really enjoyed our stay The hotel is five mins from the Stazione Termini - described as a dodgy area in all the guidebooks but, as previous reviewers have said, we found the area far enough from the station to be fine and there are many good local restaurants with 10% off to hotel residents. We loved the Meid in Napoli restaurant for its tricolore salad and pizzas. We had a triple room which was very clean if a bit cosy. It was also very noisy being on the main street - I would ask for a room at the back if possible but we weren't bothered by any internal noise. we were lucky to have sunny weather all week so took our breakfast up on to the roof - a great place to sit in the sun though you do have to fend off the pigeons! i thought the breakfast was varied and more than adequate. There is no lounge area and a very small, expensive bar so I wouldn't recommend that. If the weather was bad you might want a hotel with more to do or more centrally placed but being so near to Termini means you are on the metro routes and at the bus station so it's really easy to get around all the sights. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FUN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Noogles85
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Hotel Des Artistes in August 2009 and it was so much fun! The people there were extremely helpful and professional. Their customer service was impeccable. They assisted us on things to do, quickest ways to get where we wanted to go, and more. Also, there is a bar on the same street called Oasis. We went there 2 nights in a row and it was some of the most fun I had throughout my trip. Awesome music, strong drinks, and great friendly people that work there. I have and will continue to recommend this place to all my friends, family, and anyone that is traveling to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very tight, good location, loud until 2am.”
Reviews.Author: MsMTGlass
Reviews.Content: The room was very small and they managed to squeeze in a full bed and two twins. Of course, with those beds there was little room for suitcases, much less the smelly shoes of two boys ages 8 & 10. The bathroom was reasonably sized and shower was good. Location was very good, close to both subway lines and a couple of parking garages. I recommend you park your car and take the subway - and plan on a lot of walking. I would recommend this hotel to a party of two or three backpackers or friends, not for a family of four. It was too loud on the street and we couldn't close the windows because it got too warm with all of us in the room. I would have LOVED this hotel 20 years ago when I was traveling single and looking for nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, nice roof top terrace”
Reviews.Author: AppleCoreGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel, primarily for budget, and the reviews seemed to show that the staff were very good - we also wanted somewhere to get to easily from the main train station,Termini. We stayed in the annex, which is next door to the hotel building - we were apprehensive at first from previous reviews and double checked that we would have a private bathroom, as the main hotel building has shared bathroom with hostel style dorms as well as single rooms. The room was clean, nice shower room - no view however - our room backed on to the stair well, so noisy in the morning, with other residents clattering up and down the stairs. A nice bonus is the roof top terrace, great for evening beers (which can be bought at local supermarket, much cheaper than if bought at the hotel) Downside is that it was shut by 11pm, which is a shame as it's a nicely lit area at night and great for either a quiet couple or to get chatting to other residents. There is a bar across the street, but it did not look very appealing. Local eateries are alright, plenty of choice to shop around and get an ok deal, didn't find the area particularly relaxing for a nice evening stroll, but the terrace was a great replacement after a days worth of sight seeing. Breakfast is a buffet style assortment of bready substances, and available in the main building, nothing great and the coffee comes from an old little machine, get out and get a proper italian coffee! The staff were indeed THE most pleasantly manner staff I've ever met, all very polite and extremely helpful in sorting you out for your first visit to Rome. All in all, the Hotel Des Artistes is a good base to stick your head down and feet up after all the walking about Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hotel for exploring the eternal city!”
Reviews.Author: the_travelling_bug_7
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel des Artistes last week and we were very impressed. Our room was more of an appartment which was great for 2 girls with too many clothes and it was very clean with good air con. The hotel staff were really friendly, helpful and very forthcoming with advice about the city which made things much easier for us. The breakfast was also lovely with a great variety of food which you could either eat in their breakfast room or on the sweet roof terrace. The location was good, not far at all from Termini station from where you could either walk into the city centre or take the (very easy to use) metro to wherever you want to go. So overall, a highly recommended hotel which serves as a great base for exploring this beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money. Good hotel overall.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug1331
Reviews.Content: This little hotel was priced great and has some good perks, I would recommend for anyone looking for a good value for their money. It's located near the Termini station which we found very convenient, there's a really nice terrace that we used almost every night to end the day with a glass of wine, the hotel staff was very helpful and the rooms were clean and quiet. The bathroom shower was a bit small and the included breakfast wasn't the best when comparing with other hotels during our stay. Good hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller1971
Reviews.Content: This is a budget hotel and not posh. That suited me and the relaxed atmosphere. It is well located and close to centre and castro pretoria metro station. The staff are friendly, very helpful and accommodating. Requests were met. The hotel operation is efficiently run. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The air conditioning just about worked in the room and corridors to the rooms. This seems to be the case with air conditioning throughout Rome. One downside is that the lift and stair area is not air conditioned and was very hot. This area also needs some decoration and maintenance. The lift itself is antique. The hot water supply in the bathroom fluctuated but was ok in the August heat. The fridge in the room and safe are useful accessories. There is also a baggage room where stuff can be left after checking out. I thought the breakfast was good enough but choices do not vary from day to day. The breakfast room/servery with a few tables for eating is very small, crowded and unsuitable. The option is to eat in the roof garden which is what we did, providing you dont mind the pigeons that fly in looking for scraps. Overall we enjoyed our stay. Its difficult to assess value for money and how it compares with other hotels as I dont have any experience of the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: JEastty
Reviews.Content: Very clean, good beds, nice common room. Great location, helpful staff. Don't worry about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the money: great breakfast and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleTNtraveller
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The room was spacious and we even had a balcony...not a great view, but it was nice to have it. The room had a mini fridge where we were able to chill some wine and then we were able to enjoy that on the roof top terrace. We did have a private bathroom which was great, but the soap was so tiny it was like a communion wafer. We ended up buying some soap at a pharmacy around the corner. I would recommend bringing your own shampoo, soap, and wash cloth (although all are provided, just not the best). The breakfast at the hotel was great. It was served buffet style and they had a wide selection of pastries,rolls, meats, and cheeses. They also had coffee and juice. I was impressed with the selection. Plus, you could put it on a tray and take it back to your room or enjoy breakfast outside on the roof top terrace. The location of the hotel was great as well. It was within walking distance of the main Termini and just around the corner was an underground stop. So, the hotel was within easy travel distance of all the tourist spots, even though the hotel itself is not in one of the more well known areas. Overall, we had a great stay and it was an awesome hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, safe place, convenient access.”
Reviews.Author: nearzena
Reviews.Content: We only had one day to stop in rome, hop off the train, see sights and go to sleep. The hotel was easy to find out of the train station on foot (except the street address numbers evens and odds don't match up across from each other, but that's not their fault, don't panic)and the metro was on the next block past the hotel. Within 10 minutes of leaving the hotel and hopping on the metro, you can be at the coloseum! There was a "fast food" Oasis cafe across the street that had a beer and dinner plate sized pizza for 5 euros and a nice local joint on the way to the metro. The neighborhood was much safer looking than other reviews lead me to believe it would be and rome too was cleaner than other cities we visited on our trip (we're talking about you Athens, Greece and Naples area, Italy!) plus the Hotel des Artistes had a security camera linked door buzzer for those scare-d-cats. The staff was young, polite, multi-lingual and friendly. We would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Front desk”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaRuthie
Reviews.Content: Our family of four visited Rome for several days while on a family vacation. Although we have traveled to several other major cities in Europe, we had not been to Rome before. We picked Hotel des Artistes based upon location and the reviews we had read. Generally we pick local or boutique hotels because we feel we get a more authentic experience. While the room size was just as expected (typical European Quad room - a tight fit for 4 with luggage), it was clean and comfortable. The mini fridge in the room was a bonus as it was quite hot that week (34 C / 93 F degrees). We went to the market less than 1 block away and got several snacks and bottles of water to put in the fridge. The breakfast was adequate and filling but nothing special. However, the front desk staff was great. We spoke with three different employees during our stay and all were polite, helpful and spoke conversational English. After expressing to them that we do not like tourist type restaurants, they truly made an effort to send us to restaurants that locals frequent. We had some truly simple, affordable and wonderful food (no fast food) thanks to the guidance of the front desk staff. Our reservation said we would have to pay a key deposit, but we were never asked or billed for that during or after our stay. Lastly, the hotel had contracted with a taxi service for a flat rate to the airport (FCO) - 40 Euros. It was cheaper for a family of four to take a taxi than use the airport express train from Tremini. Location We stayed in the hotel's main building. The hotel's location is fairly close to Tremini Station about 6 blocks or so. But you do not want to be right next to Tremini because it is noisy and not so safe at night according to the locals. We are adventurous and walked to Tremini one night - and I was not completely comfortable like I was in other parts of Rome. The hotel is also about 1-2 blocks from the Castro Pretorio metro station on the blue line (3 stops away from the Colesseum). The street Via Villafranca is quiet and there are at least a dozen hotels within a 3 block radius. Some other notes about the hotel: Small elevator - 2 trips for us with our luggage. Lots of international guests - several college aged backpackers / cyclers Clean spacious bathroom in our room (for Europe) Security door for the lobby - must be buzzed in and out In-room safe Affordable Wi-Fi & local calls Pleasant other hotel staffers This is not a luxury or American style hotel, but if you are looking for something more interesting Hotel des Artistes was affordable and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Twinkle79
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Rome for my 30th Birthday last week and had chosen Des Artistes due to good reviews and good price for location, well they were all true! We arrived in drizzle but only a 5 min walk from Central Termini to the Hotel, we got a warm welcome from the staff, given our room details and they then went through all the places suitable to visit in the rain. Our room was on the first floor, it was clean and tidy, small ish bathroom but everything we needed for our 4 night break. After unpacking our soggy cases thanks for Altalia airline we had a wander around Rome and finally the sun came out, after a long afternoon we retreated back to the hotel for a drink before dinner. We went up to the 6th Floor where the lovely terrace is, the hotel is only missing one thing - a proper bar at the top. You can get drinks from reception but it would really make a difference with a nice bar. Apart from that we could not fault the hotel at all. They even give you breakfast vouchers for Bruce and Franks cafe just around the corner, Cappuccino and a croissant for 1.50euros, well worth using as most cafes are charging 4euro a coffee!! Most things are within walking distance although the tube stops at the top of the main road, I'd advise buying a 3 or 7 day ticket as you can use on buses too. Overall a great thumbs up and will recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Rooms, just right for a 6 year old”
Reviews.Author: AzulitaArizona
Reviews.Content: The AC didn't work very well, the humidity was icky. The room (with two single beds) was tiny. I am only 5'2" and my feet were dangling off the end of the bed. The European twin bed is much smaller than a U.S. twin bed. If you are tall or large, a standard room is not for you. The shower stall was so small, I bruised my arms on the doors which enclosed you as you showered. Water pressure was nil, took forever to wash my thick hair. Shaving your legs in the shower, not so easy, better off putting your feet up in the bathroom sink like you did when you were in college. HOWEVER, great access to the blue metro line, so easy transportation may balance out any inconvenience in the hotel room itself. The gentlemen at the Front Desk who spoke perfect English were also very kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Classic Room & Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: MissDeAnne
Reviews.Content: The Service was fantastic! We stayed for my fiance's Birthday and were given a room exactly as I had seen on the website, not large, but cosy enough to be romantic and classically decorated. Even though it was December, it was stilll warm enough weather to have breakfast on the roof garden amongst the flowers. The staff were very friendly and available to direct us to all of the places we wished to see. The location is within a few minutes walk of Terminal station and the subway which meant we could get to everywhere we needed to see literally within a few short tube stops. We found Bars and Restaurants on the surrounding streets, when we decided to stay closer to the hotel, the restaurant next door being very reaonable, friendly and delicious too! The Hotel is not overly grand or luxurious, but it did not dissapoint. However there are many floors and the Elevator is the old fashioned cage type which I found very quaint, but it is well used and we did end up using the stairs to go up several flights on occasions. Though as this was a sight seeing getaway we were prepared for the excercise! Hotel was perfect for a short city break for a couple or single people! Perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: letterkenny1966
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. it was recommended by a friend who had stayed there 2 years. i was a little sceptical after reading some of the reviews but i need not have worried. we had asked for a quite room when booking so we stayed at the building next door to the main hotel. it was on the 2nd floor and had quiet air conditioning, shutters on the windows, double glazing so was very quiet. we had tv, fridge, safe, hair dryer. the room was spotless. breakfast was in the main hotel which is a 10second walk away. typical continental but adequate. breakfast area is small but there is a large roof terrace to which you can bring your tray. you can also sit here during the day and evening, perfect for after dinner or pre dinner drinks (you can bring your own). staff were very helpful and friendly. location - 5-10 minutes walk from main bus/train/metro station (termini) and 2 minuest from castro pretorio metro. the red (a) and blue (b) line both leave from termine and the blue line from castro pretorio. metro is a cheap and fast way to travel around the city. €4 for a day pass for bus and metro. it can get crowded at rush hour but we could cope with this as we were only on for a few stops. the hotel is in a quiet street but there are plenty of restaurants and bars nearby. we ate at mama angela's 2 nights. our room cost €108 per night for B&B and i thought this was reasonable for the quality of this accomodation in rome. i would recommend taking a guided tour when seeing the colosseum, roman forum and palatine. you can pick up a tour from the front of the colosseum for €22 including entrance tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: dorgamas
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for my family’s first time holiday in Rome. We travelled with our 2 teenage girls and we simply loved it. We were given a spacious and comfortable “red” family room on the 4th floor, as requested, nicely furnished in a classic style. The room was richly decorated by antique paintings and lamp. The perfect central location of the hotel and its proximity to the metro added to its value: You can reach the Coliseum in just 10 minutes! The staff was very friendly and we our 4 night stay was just great. Their recommendations for local places to eat were excellent. The only downside about this hotel is that they don't have free local calling and internet access. Anyway we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Their intregrity is worth 10 Euros....”
Reviews.Author: shiver0777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel just over a week ago, and it is unfortunate that I feel the need to write this review. My husband and I checked in around 4 pm at night, and the clerk, Andreas, checked us in. He demanded that we give him 10 Euros for us to put down for a key deposit. He was not very friendly. I also found it unusual that we had to pay in full upon arrival. The rooms were fine, it was fairly quiet and peaceful, and we shared a bathroom which was not too bad. The problem we had was when we checked out, a different (and kind) employee helped us. We asked him for our deposit back, and he looked confused. They have this binder that they have all the deposits from other people full of 10 euros, but ours was not in there. He said they dont take deposits for this kind of room. He said he would get the manager to email us. She actualy walked in while we were leaving, and he told her what happened. She yelled at him and was VERY rude to us, and said that they dont take deposits for our type of room. We understood that they dont normally take these deposits, but they did from us and we just wanted our money back, instead we were treated with very little courtesy or respect. She told us shed talk to Andreas and email us back, but we never recieved anything. Overall, I wouldnt recommend staying here because, in hindsight, its only 10 Euros, but what happens when more money goes missing, youll likely be dismissed as we were.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely come back....”
Reviews.Author: myoUsa
Reviews.Content: I found Hotel Des Artistes in the 2009 edition of the travel guide Routard. They wrote a very positive description of this hotel and I can report that all of it is true. The hotel is elegant and our room was organized with really good taste, with bourgeois furnishing and a plasma tv set. The bathroom had a marble sink and the deep blue walls created a very relaxing and pleasant atmosphere. All spotless clean. We had a room in the annexe part that seemed to be a residential hotel in itself. Very quiet and comfortable, with no noise or disturbance at night. We were given an electronic key that we kept with us for the whole stay, so there was no need to ask the reception for it every time we came back from our seesightings. The key opened the front gate, then an inner door and at the end our room. The validity of our key expired on our departure day and with such a security system we felt really safe. Moreover there was an electronic safe in our room where we stored our values. Breakfast was served in the breakfast room on the fifth floor in the next door hotel section. We used the very pretty roof top terrace for our breakfast, a floor up from the breakfast room. It is an ideal place to have a cup of coffee and croissant while reading a newspaper (you can find one at the lobby area) during a sunny day, and we did just that! For those used to have a full breakfast there is a wide choice of other food such as ham, salami and cheese. The staff we met there were extremely welcoming, smiling and helpful and some of them spoke French as well! Upon arrival we were given all useful information regarding the city, hotel area and places for lunch/ dinner. Moreover we received a great assistance from them every time we ask for it. Good value for money. We will definitely come back there and will recommend the Hotel Des Artistes to everyone who seeks a central located hotel of a good standard.

Reviews.Title: “Won't return”
Reviews.Author: 1000placestogo
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review for a long time and finaly got around to it. My family and I reserved two private rooms for our first night in Rome and our last. Upon check in the clerk (friendly enough) didn't seem sure of what she was doing but finally assigned our two rooms. Small and clean they were not close together as I requested but on different floors. Since the hotel had no security and business offices were on the same floor as one of the rooms (a really weird setup that did not make me feel safe at all), my husband and son shared a room and I shared a room with my two girls. On checkout the next day, my credit card was declined. I knew something was wrong as it was only the beginning of our vacation and the card had ample room to charge all of our hotel stays and rental car. I tried to pay in travellers cheques but they refused stating cash or credit only. So I told my children to stay in the room and their father and I would find a bank to get the required cash. We walked all the way to the Temini before we could find a bank machine (our bill for two rooms was over $500..) In the meantime the front desk was phoning my children telling them they had to vacate the room and threatening them -they were terrified. We decided we should pick up the rental car, but the credit card was again declined -the rental car company determined on our behalf that the hotel had incorrectly put a hold on our card for an exhorbitant amount -hence the declines, unfortunately although the credit card company would reverse it, the process would require confirmation from the hotel that we did not actually owe the amount and as a resut the reversal would take several days before the card could be used again. Fortunately we had another card and manged to get the car. When we returned to the hotel the owner was belligerent with us and had been yelling at our kids. As I paid the bill I asked that they cancel our reservation for the last night as there was no way we would return -my childrens first day in Rome had been ruined. You can guess the rest -we were charged $400. for a no show on the last evening of our trip -on the card that was declined initially!! (we found a great hotel around the corner for less money and far superior accomodations). Attempts to get the credit card company to reverse the charge were unsuccessful as I did not have a cancellation #.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkTraveler45
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 7 nights in Feb. The room was small by American standards, but that should be no surprise in Europe, and it was very comfortable. The staff were very welcoming and helpful throughout the stay. They were particularly helpful dealing with Al Italia, which had lost a piece of my luggage. The staff who worked the reception desk may have been the best hotel staff I have ever had contact with. Unless you want to stay in a particular part of Rome, this area was as good as any to stay in. It was very close to the Metro. The area was nice, pretty quiet, filled with hotels and restaurants. Breakfast was very good, and the staff preparing the food were very efficient. There is a roof garden for eating outside, if the indoor area gets crowded, and it did. There was a refrigerator and safe in the room. Any problems were immediately taken care of. The hotel played a large part in a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: LongingTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend and would say it's more your 'backpacker' kind of place. It wasn't the best but it wasn't the worst. The location was quite good - just five minutes walk from the main railway station. It was quiet and the staff were friendly enough yet quite detached from the guests from what I felt and saw. The room wasn't as expected; instead it was claustrophobic and dated - a far cry from the photographs published on the website. Unfortunately it came with a shared bathroom but that was my fault. The room was clean enough and attended to (although i don't actually remember seeing the room any different from how my friend and I left it) but the bathroom needed a lot more attention. This was a major drawback but it was my mistake to have accepted shared bathroom amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: leamtake
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Des Artistes and can safely recommend it to anyone looking for a break away in Rome. The receptionist (tall with long dark hair) when I checked in was great and helped me with all of my questions, so a special thanks go to her. The room was very nicely decorated and I really enjoyed relaxing there after touring the city, the only addition that could have made it more perfect would have been a bath tub! But at the price I paid I cannot complain! Breakfast was in abundance and the croissants were delicious! LK, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Friendly helpful service people, amazing decor and very classic hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: sweet_nicole_15
Reviews.Content: We had been visited a awful Chinese run family hostel and turned to find a little better one with reasonable price. But the hotel des artist was absoluately amazing and out of our expectation, and only with half of the family runed hostel. The receptionist Danna helped us very a lot for 3 days, face to face and throught telephone. I had lived a few 5 star hotels in differnt countries, however, no where is better than here, between home and fancy hotel. If I will come to Rome again, I will straightly go ahead to live in this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, personal hotel with an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: AirlineFreak
Reviews.Content: It was my girlfriend's birthday, so I decided to surprise her with a trip to Rome. We had a great time and I must say that Hotel Des Artistes had their fair share in that. I had done a bit of research before booking, but I was a bit concerned since the hotel was cheaper than the other ones in the same category that I had looked at. All worries were in vain! When we turned up, we realised that the walk from the train station to the hotel was shorter than it had seemed to us on the map at first. It's only a couple of minutes walk from the main train station and the area is full of nice restaurants. Not at all like the shady areas you sometimes find around train stations in big cities around Europe. You felt that you were in a "real" Rome, where real Romans lived. Of course it was handy to be close to the train station with its metro lines and busses all around the city, but, frankly, everything was within walking distance anyway. Now, I had let the hotel know that it was my girlfriend's birthday, but I didn't expect them to take notice. On the contrary, when we arrived, they had put a bottle of prosecco in the room for us! The room was fantastic as well. Very classy. Definitely more than you would expect in this price range. Nice paintings on the walls. Not the cheap, mass produced things that you get in chain hotels. It added a personal touch to the place. Of course, in a city like Rome, you don't spend much time in the hotel, but it was still a very nice atmosphere to come back to after full days of sightseeing. The hotel seemed to be fairly popular at the time we stayed there, but we didn't hear the any noise from other rooms, so we got nothing but great sleeps all nights. The staff was really helpful, spoke perfect English (unlike many people in Italy) and provided maps, recommendations etc. in the little reception next to the breakfast room. Breakfast was refreshingly non-Italian (meaning you actually get more than just a coffee) and had everything we were used to with our Northern European breakfast habits (cereals etc.) - including warm smiles from the breakfast staff every morning (which helped you wake up if you're not a morning person ;) ). I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Hotel des Artistes to anybody who wants a comfortable, warm, quality hotel with a convenient location and still at a reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “Rome weekend”
Reviews.Author: jrvalle
Reviews.Content: Very well located, you can walk from Termini even at night(train arrival from airport). The room was large enough and confortable, air conditioned essential and working well. Reception and breakfast were in another building - the feeling is more like staying in an apartment then in a hotel - there was a very nice garden roof terrace to have breakfast. We enjoyed very much the weekend and we think it was a very good price for what we get - it is not a very fancy and charming place but very practical, clean, safe and confortable with a family touch!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business people”
Reviews.Author: Jamshid-Traveller
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Italy to meet my business partners in Rome. Just has a three day stay there. I found Hotel Des Artistes on the net, and booked it immediately, as I found their offers and prices quite attractive. Hotel is small, but very nice. It is family run and very friendly. I had good wi-fi connection and really enjoyed my stay. I do recommend this hotel for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel at the incredibly low rates!!!”
Reviews.Author: S-P78JW
Reviews.Content: Whilst choosing a hotel for my stay at Rome I didn’t have an impression that this hotel was exactly what I looked for but finally my boyfriend convinced me and we booked a room in the annexe part of the building. I was absolutely wrong because everything was AMAZING there! I haven’t been so positively surprised for a long time! When checking in we met extremely welcoming and friendly multilingual staff that remembered us very quickly. We always found someone there ready to assist us and give any kind of information we might need. We were given suggestions of restaurants and trattorias as well, and we really hit in jackpot with one of them (great Roman kitchen)! Our room was delicious. Stylish dark furnishing, marvellous antique paintings in sculpted golden frames and accurately matched fabrics made exceptionally warm and elitist atmosphere in our room. Soft delicate lights added to whole décor. For this comfort we have been actually undercharged!!! The hotel was conveniently located in a short walking distance to Termini Station, where the entire transportation system of Rome was concentrated, and what’s more, one of the underground stations was just behind the hotel and gave us the direct access to the Coliseum and all historic area of the city. I can’t forget the fantastic roof terrace, neither, where we enjoyed the delightful evenings with a glass of red wine. I will definitely come back to Des Artistes and recommend this hotel to everyone who travels to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel with Good Location”
Reviews.Author: laloutreamericaine
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely comfortable and priced very reasonably. If you are looking for an upscale, luxury hotel, then you should look elsewhere, but as a group of students, we payed hostel price for a hotel setting. The multilingual staff was extremely helpful and took the time to make sure that we were comfortable. It is in a good location - not far from the train station but away from the city nightlife, meaning it was safe, secure, calm and quiet at all hours. I would recommend this hotel particularly to students who are traveling abroad and want a good deal of comfort for not a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: loveinrome
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very easy to find in a good location round the corner from the main station. All reception staff very friendly and helpful especially the man on duty in the evening. Tall, dark hair. He recommended places of interest and always tried to make conversation when we entered reception. Thank you very much, we enjoyed ourselves :-) We only booked the family room and it was spacious, modern and spotless - we were very impressed. I would definitley recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome. Fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: sksohio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to get to from the train station. Located on a one way street with late night eateries very close, it is charming. Breakfast was included and the roof top garden eating area was a bonus for both morning and evening relaxation. Our room was very spacious and clean. The staff spoke English and were very gracious and helpful in directing us to specific areas. We felt very safe and would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great place at a bargain price!

Reviews.Title: “Booked at their hotel and placed somewhere else. Be aware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jogefo
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked at Hotel des Artistes and upon arrival I was put at another building called myhotel or something, but was actually a residential place. I argued with the person at check in that I had to have a room at my original hotel, but they refused to accommodate my legitimate request. Unacceptable; I should have called the tourist police, but was tired from the trip. Even their reception at the 5th floor which is very inconvenient as well. Breakfast very poor as well.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: duckyspazz
Reviews.Content: Everything about the place is great, it is on a quiet street (for Roman standards), it has a fabulous roof terrace, the location is really convenient but after staying there for two days i am covered in more than 25 bed bug - spider - flea - i have no idea what DIME (1 cm wide) sized red itchy spots.... let me tell you. It looks gross. I am not sure if it was just my bed or what but it will keep me from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms were quaint and very comfortable. The service was wonderful .”
Reviews.Author: poohski
Reviews.Content: We spent our first night in Italy at this hotel. It was very convenient to take the subway to the sites we wanted to see. I would certainly like to stay here again when I return to Rome. The staff was very pleasant and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: dobstick
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was a cold buffet but very fresh and filling. Staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent english. I would definitely stay there again and have no hesitation in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tom13
Reviews.Content: The staff really made us feel at home. We certainly enjoyed the atmosphere, this is nice people , very helpful. Their restaurant recommendations (just outside the hotel) were wonderful, they were very polite. Very good customer service. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The location was very convenient (Colosseum was about a ten minutes walk), we felt safe and welcomed. A reasonably priced hotel. No drawback. I have no complaints about the hotel whatsoever. I recommend Hotel Des Artistes.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL HELL EXPERIENCE - AVOID IT LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!”
Reviews.Author: brucethepirate
Reviews.Content: Bait and Switch says it all. While some customers apparently get real Hotel Artistes rooms, other customers (including me) get directed to a (likely unregistered) apartment twice as far from the station, (they call it the "Hotel Nice") in horrible surroundings (graffitti-covered alley, broken glass on door, no sign for "Hotel"), with no A/C as promised, terrible place, stuck metal shutters w/no window (death trap in fire), hellishly hot, not even a lock on the door. Not enough room here to tell how awful an experience it was (12:30 AM, have to leave the next day at 7, and I spent until 2 AM getting to and finding the hellhole, just for starters). DONT TRUST HOTEL DES ARTISTES --- THEY ARE DISHONEST. Artistes has gotten great reviews in the past - I would guess that original owners sold after success due to reviews, then greedy and dishonest current owners try to shove overflow to any nearby space (probably illegal and unregistered) that they can rent. We insisted our reservation was with Artistes, and they could not send us away - but to no avail. Note: I reserved with Expedia. Expedia was not at all helpful when I called at the time, which doubled the horror. On return they did refund, but that did not make it OK.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed stay at Hotel Des Artistes”
Reviews.Author: limone2
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel Des Artistes was great. I expected to stay in a comfortable and clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff and it was exactly as I imagined it to be just as it seems on their website. I didn't spend a bundle so I had money left over to fill myself up with all that excellent Italian icecream! Definitely will stay here again. The breakfast was very good on the rooftop and it was buffet which is definitely a plus. I had no trouble getting around because the hotel is right near Termini station and there is practically everything you need in the area from bars, to pubs, restaurants and supermarkets and it helps that the reception is open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Des Artistes was an excellent choice for us, location and Service”
Reviews.Author: ItalyReal
Reviews.Content: Hotel Des Artistes location near Roma Termini, in a quiet and safe street, plus the excellent service provided by the staff, make this hotel an excellent value at a reasonable price. The rooms are spacious, with a private bathroom. My wife, her sister, nephew and I had spent two nights July 2008, and enjoyed a good night sleep and a perfect complimentary breakfast on the garden terrace, in the mornings. What a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value at Hotel des Artistes”
Reviews.Author: Divers-group
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel des Artistes several times and have found the rooms clean and nicely decorated. The website is easy to use and the staff members helpful. We appreciated the in-room safe and being able to have breakfast on the roof of the building. One of the best features is the proximity to the Rome Metro (Castro Pretorio Station) -- very convenient. The entrance to the hotel is a little odd in that the reception office is on the 5th floor and there is a very small elevator to get you there. However, it's worth squeezing into the elevator (no more than 2 people with luggage at a time). There are several good restaurants and 2 ATMs within a couple of blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Susan5619
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend who stayed there a year ago; it lived up to his recommendation: conveniently located, clean, friendly staff. The hotel is within easy walking distance (even with luggage--but only if it rolls!) of the main train station in Rome (Termini), and there is a subway stop close by the hotel on the "B" line. Termini is also where the 2 subway lines connect for transfers, and is the main hub for city buses. There are many hotels and restaurants nearby. The neighborhood felt safe. The staff conversed easily in English and helped with finding restaurants, and getting around Rome (good maps provided). We had a buffet breakfast on the roof top garden terrace which was a delightful way to start the day. The rooms were clean and comfortable; we had no trouble with noisy neighbors. There is one very small elevator which we only used for transporting luggage. If you can't negotiate stairs, this hotel could be a problem for you. The reception desk is on the 5th floor. We only had 2 days in Rome, but Hotel Des Artistes was in the right location for us.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in June”
Reviews.Author: mavwilltrav
Reviews.Content: I really like the quirkiness of this hotel. The hotel and room was spotless when we arrived and the room was maintained in this manner throughout our stay. Although the room was air conditioned(and the air conditioning looked new) it did not work at all effectively and it was of more benefit to open the windows at night to cool the room. I noticed that by the end of our 4 day stay, the staircase was looking rather dusty and dirty and commented that I would not like this to be my first impression as it had been spottless when we arrived. Another downer was being asked to pay up front even though we had read previous reports that described this as the hotels process. The hotel is located quite close to a metro stop and also within walking distance of the Termini. We used the metro once, however preffered walking to the sites and this was achievable from this location. We found the staff to be very helpful with any questions on touring etc, all had good english amongst other languages. In summary except for the airconditioning, we were happy with our stay. Would we stay again? Perhaps would try another area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting.”
Reviews.Author: Bethy_Dub
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our credit card company after looking online at its website and the reviews on tripadvisor. I have to say, I have never in my LIFE experienced something so different from what I expected. First, be aware this is a youth hostel. The good reviews it has been given by other users must be from people who knew and expected this. We did not. Considering we spend $177 per night for a room, we expected an average three-star hotel. Instead, we had the following: NO air-conditioning (although it is advertised, the unit in the room blew only hot air... and it was 100 degrees outside), filthy facilities including MOLD in the bathroom, a broken shower door, and beer lids in the hallways, dog poop on the stoop outside, a five-floor climb to the reception area, and rude service. Oh, not to mention the maid who walked in on us. It was truly the worst experience I have ever had, and caused me to hate Rome and leave early. It is not simply a matter of different standards, as I have traveled extensively throughout Central America and have always had better and cleaner facilities. I actually believe it is CRIMINAL what they charged for this hotel, and I think they knew it and did it intentionally. Oh, and PS -- we checked the Best Western across the street (Best Western Villafranca), and it cost less per night. Go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Fells like they are doing you a favour!!”
Reviews.Author: Fabidias
Reviews.Content: First of all, it´s very unconfortable to have to pay your staying in advance, am I running out without paying ?? I don´t think so!! The Hotel Des Artistes website shows a thematic hotel, with friendly people, but arriving the place you get nothing. 1. The reception guy was very rude, like he was doing me a favour... 2. The air conditioned did not work... 3. You can´t get a botlle of water and be charged in your final bill... 4. Girls in the reception really try to help us, but this guy in the reception makes our staying very bad.

Reviews.Title: “When in Rome...Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: haygirl16
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It is a short distance to a Metro stop, and within walking distance to the main Metro stop in Rome. There is a WONDERFUL little Italian restaurant a few blocks away. You get a discount there for staying at the hotel, and the food is already really cheap. The hotel has a rooftop patio where we ate breakfast every morning. Very pretty. The rooms are clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr_UK_Tourist
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel close to the city Centre, very convenient for the metro and a short walk from the main Terminii station. The hotel is a typical city centre small hotel on five floors, with the reception on the fifth floor. All floors (except the roof terrace) are accessible by a rather cranky, but functional lift running up the central staircase. Generally the hotel was clean; our room was functional with original artworks on the wall, the staff were friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was a simple typical small hotel continental breakfast which could be taken to your room, in the eating small area or on the roof terrace which was our preference.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and decent value!”
Reviews.Author: pontificator
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in March. We prebooked this hotel for our arrival in Rome. Well located near the Terminal but far enough away to avoid the mobs this is a comfortable "value" hotel with helpful (and young) English speaking staff and large comfortable room for under a E100 per night (we were off season). We stayed in two different rooms and both were pretty large and comfortable but non-descript with nice bathrooms and a balcony overlooking a small courtyard. The rooftop garden was a nice find for a good hangout and rest, the breakfast was just OK. The hotel was quiet with no disturbances while we were there. Overall we found it a good choice for our 3 days in Rome and an excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “It's not your typical Priceline 3-Stars category”
Reviews.Author: ms-itchyfeet
Reviews.Content: Anyone who uses Priceline regularly for hotels in USA and Canada, beware.....the star rating system for European hotels is way below our North American hotels. I use Priceline all the time for booking hotels within USA and Canada, and it had been great. In New York, I stayed at Marriot Marquis, Marriot Uptown, Hyatt Central Station, Continental Barclay....all for under $250/night. When I'm broke I stay at Quarter's Club in Wall Street for only $120/night, thanks to Priceline, I don't have to stay in Jersey or Queens. Anywhere else I stay at places like Marriot Coutyard and Holiday Inn Express for $100/night.. When I tried Priceline for Rome, I chose 3-stars, central location, $120 (this was November 2005, I'm talking low season). I did expect the location would be around Piazza della Repubblica and Termini, which I didn't mind, I actually liked Termini, it had all the shops I needed for last minute purchases before heading home. Priceline got me Hotel Des Artistes. It was far from Termini. It was actually close to Castro Pretorio and it was not the type of 3-Stars I expected from Priceline that places Courtyard and HI Express in that category. The room was definitely spotless, but it located within a residential building, not even connected to the building where the reception was located (the reception was on the 5th floor of a different residential building). I felt like I was staying at someone's home instead of a hotel. The staff were okay, breakfast was good. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “liked it !”
Reviews.Author: Theexotictraveler
Reviews.Content: We took the train from the airport to termini. Its was really hard to find the Hotel...and no one we spoke to talk english...when we finnaly got to the hotel we went up to the reception and got the room key. The room was okey,..Clean okey bed and nice badrom..The people who worked at the hotel were polite and frindly. The breakfast was okey..I liked it, but my boyfriend didnt like it. All in alle it was a okey hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean”
Reviews.Author: tara_c48
Reviews.Content: Great location close to the train station, but not too close to be worried about crime. Friendly staff, clean rooms, comfortable bed. We shared a bathroom and shower, but they always seemed to be open so it wasn't a problem. They have a great upper veranda where you can have a drink or eat. They sell some food and beverages there, but I recommend going to a shop around the corner for better prices. They don't mind if you bring in your own food and drink. In room safe was a plus. Reception isn't on the first floor, so take the stairs or elevator up. We noticed mostly young travelers here. I recommended this place to some friends and they enjoyed their trip as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: xdorax
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room. The room is clean and big :) It's not exactly close to the station but it's within safe walking distance. There are a few restaurants round that area but didn't manage to try it out though. Its reception isn't on the ground floor - which isn't a BIG problem but does cause some stress when you are dragging a big suitcase and find out that you have to go all the way up to check in then down to your room again. There is lift but it's those kind of old and scary ones. Overall, I enjoyed my stay. It's not the best, but it's good enough, especially with this price. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: getaways38
Reviews.Content: Room was located several buildings away from actual hotel bldg...not as advertised. Given the location, security was in question. Business services as advertised were five blocks away in a laundramat. There are many other more acceptable hotels near the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - a bit far from central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Emyr_Elen
Reviews.Content: We paid £55 a night including breakfast and booked through the hotel's own website. Hotel des Artistes is located in the area close to Termini station which isn't the best area of Rome. We didn't personally experience any problems but we didn't always feel totally comfortable when walking the streets at night. It is a good 45 minutes walk to most of the central attractions. Having said that, the Castro Pretorio Metro station is close-by and you can easily and cheaply get to Spagna station (for the Spanish Steps), Ottaviano station (for St Peters) or Colosseo (surprisingly for the Coloseum!). To get to the Centro Storico (Parthenon, Trevi fountain etc) you're probably better off getting the bus - plenty of them pass near the hotel, but they do get crowded in rush hour. The hotel itself is located on the upper floors of the building and access is via an antique lift! The man on reception was helpful and gave us vouchers for 10% off at a couple of local restaurants (of which there are quite a few to choose from, although we tended to eat in the centre of Rome mainly). Our room was clean and tidy and had satellite tv. It was, however, a bit dark due to the decor and since the only window overlooked an internal courtyard. There was no trouble with noise and we had 6 pleasant nights' sleep. The breakfast room was being refurbished while we were there - which turned out to be a blessing! The alternative was a pokey little room or the fantastic roof terrace! We went for the roof terrace and enjoyed a nice continental breakfast in warm (20 degrees c) sunshine in November!! I'd recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget, but if you can afford a more central location, I'd go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at hotel Des Artistes”
Reviews.Author: P-A-J-74
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Des Artistes for two nights of Aug 1 and 2, 2007. We are a family of two adults and one child aged 5 yrs and a baby aged 5 months, so we were hoping for a decent sized room. The double room we checked into was a good size, given that hotels in continental Europe tend to have small rooms. It was clean and the linen was changed daily. A baby bed was provided at no extra cost. The only snag was that the AC was not powerful enough and this was annoying given the heat in Rome. The price at EUR 110 per night per room might be a bit steep, but given the location (a 5 min walk from Termini station) and a decent area, we are not complaining. The price included breakfast, charged at EUR 7.75 per person, which though plentiful, was standard continental fare of croissants, coffee, cheese etc. I suggest you give this a miss and head out for breakfast. Much cheaper and more options. Another tip is regarding the hop-on-hop-off tourist buses in Rome. The best deal is on the "110 Open Trambus" which is run by Rome municipality. They have a frequency of a bus every 10 min (whereas the others are at one bus every half hour) and the two day EUR 24 deal including the Archeobus is a good buy. However, this line is not advertised in any hotel. So one needs to go to their Termini station counter to buy tickets. Overall, I recommend this hotel for a pleasant stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “could have been better”
Reviews.Author: fsb1904
Reviews.Content: When we arrived in Rome, all we wanted was to stay in a nice, clean hotel. it was both of those things, but the thing i forgot to make sure they had was an air conditioning. unfortunately, in the middle of july in Rome, it is not the best weather to stay in. it was so hot at night that we couldn't sleep and so hot during the day that we had to find refuge in other areas. if you are going to Rome during a cooler part of the year, it is great, otherwise make sure the place you go to has A/C

Reviews.Title: “Great rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: Enemark
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good place to stay - good family rooms, although a bit small, nice staff, a good location and a great rooftop terrace. We were two families with 4 teenage boys, and they loved to hang out on the roof at night or go to one of the internet cafes in the area. The streets around the hotel are full of little, good restaurants - and the Metro is only 2 minutes away. Termini is about 5 minutes away - and there was nothing sleazy about the area. Actually it felt good to get a bit away from the more packed areas of Rome around the major attractions. So for a family holiday stay don't have any hesitations about this place.

Reviews.Title: “think twice before booking”
Reviews.Author: latina-princess
Reviews.Content: I had called the night before to confirm our reservations and the gentelman on the phone confimed the dates and time of arrival, i had told him that we would be arriving at around 8 in the morning and he has said it wouldn not be a problem for check in. Apon arrival we had trouble getting to the 5th floor to reach the front desk, the elevator is WAY to small and could hardly fit anything, We made this a family trip and we were traveling with our 1yr old son, so with the elevator being so small it was hard getting his stroller up and down, anyways when we tried to check in they said that our room was not ready and that we should check in at noon or 1 in the afternoon, which we would have not had a problem but since we were traveling with our young son it made it a big inconvienece, when we finally got our room it was in another building, the annex and another hassel trying to get our things in the tiny elevator. the room was small and the bed was very hard but the room itself was ver clean. The hotel is very close to the Termini Station which made it easy to go and find dinner and some shopping there, there is also a grocery store and many internet cafes, The hotel is far from all the other main attractions. The staff was very friendly and was very helpful with our questions and concerns. If we decied to take another trip to rome we will defeintly not be staying here the bad outwieghed the good, We would probably stay at another hotel close by the Termini station but this one will not be it I hope the review was helpful

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not friendly”
Reviews.Author: calahan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and found the place reasonable. Its in a good location but the hotel lacks any warmth. Its a mixture of a hotel and a backpackers and really doesnt cater for either.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: cheunggo
Reviews.Content: This hotel averaged out at about US$133 per night for a double bedroom and the reviews of this place indicated it was a good place to stay in. When we arrived, we were told that we would be staying at a sister hotel (only 10 meters away) at "My Hotel". This was confusing at first but they receptionist insisted it was part of the Hotel des Artistes and that the quality of the rooms were identical. Indeed, this was true and the rooms were very clean and well kept. Air-conditioning worked very well and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was in excellent condition and again was very clean. There were no complaints whatsoever in this regard. Breakfast was very nice as the continental breakfast was buffet-style. One even had the option of going up onto the deck and eating outside. Only thing was that the breakfast was situated back in Hotel des Artistes on Level 5! But judging from the amount of food given, I would say that it was worth it. All in all, a great little place to stay in and I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel des Artistes, Rome- Look for another place!”
Reviews.Author: Caterini
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a short (but disappointing) stay at the Hotel des Artistes. The disappointment began from the first moment we got there.The reception is on the fifth floor, where we ascended via a rickety,rattling archaic lift (which could barely hold one person with two average pieces of luggage), to be met by a "fakely polite","foreign" Italian woman who was interested in one thing - getting clients TO PAY IN ADVANCE! Of course we objected to this as we had not agreed to do so in our previous email.(We realized why clients are asked to pay up front - if you stay the first night, no wonder you will change your mind about the place.) We had requested a QUIET room in our communication, so we were given a room on the fourth floor. For 137.ooEur. we did expect to HAVE QUIET! but, the room was completely inundatedby NOISE. Noise coming from everywhere - the hostel annex on the floor above; the tiny crowded reception hall; the miserable breakfast buffet area; the luggage hold - all on the fifth floor, and, added to this, the human traffic of clumsy clodding up and down the stairs leading to the infamous "roof garden"".Oh did I mention the rattling lift, and the old wooden twin doors BANGING every time the lift was being used?Or what about the gurgling of the water running down the pipes, every time someone took a shower, or used the WC? A word about the "roof garden" - the breakfast area is so tiny and poorly laid out the you can't get out of there fast enough, once you've got something on your breakfasr tray (if you can manage to find something decent). So, you escape to the roof garden where you are met by hundreds of fat pigeons flapping about, landing on tables and (broken) chairs, sending little "poopy" messages, just so you don't forget the place.The place was dirty and poorly set out.And don't be fooled that you will see the Roman skyline! The breakfast on all three mornings was of very poor quality. We finally spoke up on the third day, having been fed up with the previous days' empty platters and empty bowls! We directly told the signora on duty that "there was NO yoghurt left" or, "NO cereal left", or "NO oranje juice"!Absolutely UNACCEPTABLE! for a hotel of that price to offer such poor standard. We chose this hotel for its reasonsbly good access to the Central Station, and the metro, but the MISERLY ATTITUDE and miserable faces of the staff should really make youLOOK FOR ANOTHER PLACE TO STAY!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing stay at Des Artistes”
Reviews.Author: Funtimesstl
Reviews.Content: Des Artistes wouldn't take a reservation by phone, but made us track down a computer while we were on vacation to send them an email. Reception is on the 5th floor, so we lugged our bags into the tiny lift, and spent in excess of 15 minutes to check in. We then found out we had to not only go back down the tiny lift, but OUT the building, down the street, to an "annex" location. Use the key to get in the building, walk past the stinking rubbish, use a key to get in another tiny lift, use a key to get in a "grouping" of 3 rooms, use a key to get in our room, use a key to turn on the lights. All while hauling our bags. Smelly room with a view of the alley. Breakfast is in the main building (not ours), 5th floor and was very crowded with not enough tables. Used to get great reviews and was a Fodor's recommendation. I believe they've been sold. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly adequate enough”
Reviews.Author: shirlBonner
Reviews.Content: Firstly I had read reviews that the reception was on the 5th floor and the lift was rather small, considering this I opted to book, I should have heeded the other reviews. The lift is FAR TO SMALL, max 2 people without luggage and very awkward to operate. Our rooms were not assigned according to our booking where we were given a double where we reserved a twin. The room itself was more than adequate, clean, comfortable and roomy, again the bathroom was light, clean and functioned as it should, the air con can be a problem, we had them switch it off as it was to noisy. For breakfast again I should have heeded the other reviewers, the room is tiny and they manage to squeeze approx six tables and the buffet tables, it is awfully cramped. The food was less than average, the hotel staff stands watch as if guarding and counting what you have to eat and drink. I felt they were on the lookout for tourist making lunches from their stock. I wouldn’t recommend staying here if your budget can stretch stay somewhere else!, you have been warned. Shirl

Reviews.Title: “Des Artistes - a curate's egg”
Reviews.Author: southdowner
Reviews.Content: Not a bad little hotel although first impressions are not overly favourable. One arrives in a small but pleasant lobby to see a sign stating reception is on the 5th floor. The minute lift, running up through the stairwell, is a squeeze for two people with anything more than rucksack-sized bags. The reception desk area is 'cosy' as long as no more than 4-5 people are waiting. The buffet dining area is cramped and throughput at breakfast is hampered by poorly thought out food/cutlery logistics. However there is a nice surprise as the 6th floor is a roof garden which is a very pleasant location for breakfast on fine days. The rooms are a decent size. We stayed in the Annexe and many of these rooms overlook an internal courtyard so are peaceful at all times of day and night and general cleanliness was good. There are numerous local restaurants to suit various budgets. The Taverna Pretoriana in Via Palestro particularly stands out for it's quality of food, hospitality, service and good value. Nick, Hampshire, UK

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: Catsnip
Reviews.Content: The web-site promised everything. I booked because I thought they were going to have a Chrismas package. Not available, so I kept the booking anyway. After a 26 hour flight we arrived on the 5th floor of this place and were asked for payment (cheaper for cash) straight away before even saying hello let alone viewing the rooms. Staff were cordial at first but not welcoming but became quiet rude when at the end of my stay I tried to justify why our stay was unsatisfactory. My sons had arrived one hour earlier and had to find the cash immediately in the hostel accomm- they weren't even able wait for us . One days total limit on ATM withdrawal. They were moved rooms three times in 7 days even though they had been booked two months ahead and had noisy and disrupted sleep in the hostel. We stayed for a week, breakfast was good even though the breakfastroom was too small , crowded and we were constantly watched by a female staff member. Water was lukewarm or cold everyday, beds were hard and on purchasing drinks on two occassions I had to ask for the correct change! I found another hotel nearby on my return to Rome 4 weeks later and it was so much more pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MissMinkle
Reviews.Content: This is a great, typical Italian hotel, the breakfast is tops and it is a steal considering how close it is to the attractions. As per the earlier review the roof garden is amazing, even in February my boyfriend and I sat up here enjoying the sun and the fantastic array of pastries we were served up for breakfast. The staff were more than helpful, it's clean, quiet, the room was lovely - and have I mentioned the lovely breakfast? What more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: NorthamptonYvonne
Reviews.Content: This is a great value hotel for the price, (especially if you pay cash on arrival); comfortable, quiet and clean rooms, very generous breakfasts and efficient service. It is a hike down to the forum, etc. but close to the station and 2 metro lines if the walking is too much for you! The reviews were spot on and we will definately feel confident in recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “A bit far from most sites”
Reviews.Author: YoungTraveller85
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was satisfactory. The bed was two twins pulled together, each with extremely hard mattresses. I slept fine, but my boyfriend did not. Clean room, quiet hotel. The staff was not rude, although they were not exceedingly friendly either. Breakfast consisted of cereal, ham, cheese, bread, canned fruit (not happy about that one), water and juice (not fresh). It was nice not having to carry our luggage very far from the train station when we arrived; however, the hotel was not very close to the sites. Before leaving on our trip we had read some negative things about the Termini area at night, but we did not have any problems. Next time I visit Rome I would prefer to stay farther west, probably near the pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pink_pirlie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel at the end of November 2004. The room was large, well decorated and cleaned excellently on a daily basis. For the price (we paid about 60 euros per night for a double room) this hotel was excellent. Breakfast was included, and consisted of cereal, cheese, ham, rolls and french pastries. The hotel was down a quiet street and nearby there was a supermarket supermarket and it was only a short walk to the central train station, and the rest of rome. Unfortunately for us there were torrential downpours and transport strikes the whole time we were there, but that's not the fault of the hotel! I would recommend the hotel to anyone with a small budget looking for a great little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Money-grabbing attitude problem”
Reviews.Author: Thefamilytraveller
Reviews.Content: The accommodation just does not reflect that shown in the website. It is shabby genteel, and not very roomy. They are quite happy to sell you a "family room" for five and cram extra beds into a space designed for not more than three. Their cancellation policy stinks, too - we gave them notice "72 hours before arrival time" (their words in their policy) to cancel a subsequent one-night stay in transit through Rome, working on an arrival time of 6 pm. They invoked an entirely inconsistent example shown in their conditions, to say that we should have cancelled 18 hours earlier - 4 complete 24 hour days before the beginning of the day of arrival! Despite our protests they are charging our credit card - which we are resisting! Redeeming features are otherwise friendly staff (it's the owners/senior managers who won't compromise) and a nice little cafe bar across the street which makes a great espresso. Close to Termini, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MMtimes2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated a few blocks from termini station so it is easy to walk there. The check in is on the fifth floor and there is a very tiny elevator to help you and your luggage on your way. There is a hostel and a hotel here with the facilities spread between two buildings. We stayed in the annex which is about 2 doors down the block. The staff was very nice and very helpful. The room was very nice. Small but completely adequate for two people and larger than many in Europe. There was a programmable safe in the room for any valuables. The water temperature kept spiking on me in the shower the final day we stayed there but not on my husband five minutes later. Walls are not really thick but after walking 12 hours straight neither of us had any problems sleeping through any residual chatter. Other than that one thing that last day I have absolutely no complaints with this hotel. The breakfast was decent. Cereal, croissants, rolls, meat, cheese, canned fruit, and yogurt. Coffee, tea, orange juice, water, and milk were also available. It was included in the room price and could be taken to the roof to eat. They have a wind enclosure up there with a portable heater for winter and it's more peaceful than downstairs. It was maybe 25 minutes to walk to the colosseum from our hotel. Not too bad. We tended to take the Metro to our farthest destination and then wander back over the course of the day. There is a B line metro stop a block from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: Chisolm
Reviews.Content: We got into Rome at about 10:00 at night and Hotel Des Artists had given our room away! I had made reservations several weeks earlier and had a copy of our confirmation page, to no avail. The staff sent us to another hotel called the "Discovery Hotel" that was suppose to have the same amentities as advertised by Des Artists. Ha! We were suppose to have 3 beds and the room they gave us had one! I went down to complain to mng. and low and behold, there is another American couple at the front desk and THEY had had reservations at Des Artists, too! Only they were told their room had "electrical problems" (I'm sure they gave that couple's room away, too). We ended-up with a room with 3 beds after a near fight with the Discovery Hotel desk clerk and didn't receive a lot of the amenities that were suppose to have been offered by Des Artists (free breakfasts, roof top view, etc.) My recommendation..... don't go to either one of these hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Roof garden was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: JSez
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this hotel. We stayed in the annex and in the main hotel, in each area the rooms were small yet very comfortable, well maintained, and clean. And as other reviewers have indicated, the elevator was small, but it was quite manageable. The staff was friendly to us throughout our stay, answering all questions we had, allowing us to check in early and use the roof garden after we had checked out. The roof garden was the highlight of this hotel. Nothing beat relaxing at the end of a day full of sightseeing in a comfortable green space with a bottle of wine and the sounds of the streets below.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Barry06
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 3 nights (23-26.10.2006) at this Hotel. The Hotel is a 10 min walk from the main Terminal Station in Rome and don't believe all the hype that this is not a safe area. It is busy all day and night with people bars and Resturants everywhere. Its more dangerous in London. Rome is safe but do watch out for the pickpockets! On arrival very friendly and helpful staff and a great mixture of guests from all over the world. The room was extremley clean and well set out with enough room for the 3 of us, although we spent little time in there as there is so much to see. The reception is on the 5th floor but thats no problem even with our son who is blind. Breakfast ( good and very filling continental) and evening drinks (10 euros for a litre of beer and a good bottle of red) were taken on the roof terrace which was a relaxing place to sit and just take it all in after a hard day of sightseeing. Overall the Hotel and staff were excellent, they provided help re getting around Rome and were a friendly crowd. The Hotel is extremley central for getting anywhere in Rome with a Metro line round the corner 2 mins and the main Terminal for bus's and metro 10 mins walk. And off course only 30 mins by train from the two airports We will be returning again to enjoy another break in Rome and will stay at this Hotel again as it caters for everything you need. And with a great location clean Hotel and well appointed rooms and helpful staff it made our stay an enjoyable one. Barry- Blackheath London

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the money”
Reviews.Author: LW1
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night in the hostel (not hotel) at the end of a trip. Wanted somewhere near to Termini so location was ideal. I was too exhausted to do much exploring of the rest of the neightbourhood, but there seemed to be a few bars and restaurants, and decent bus and metro links to the rest of the city. Free internet access was very handy, as was the good selection of vending machines (including one vending bottles of wine and corkscrews). Bunk bed in dorm was comfortable enough. Nothing special, but good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: cjohnson58
Reviews.Content: Great Location to the Train Station. We could just walk a few blocks and catch the train to wherever we needed to go. The hotel was very clean. The staff was helpful, some were more friendly then others. The elevator or lift was a little awkward but we finally adjusted. The breakfast got a little old after 4 days and the dishes were sometimes dirty but to take your breakfast up to the rooftop to eat made it not seem so bad. It is very nice up there.
