After we would get back from our evenings out we would always gather up there to enjoy a beer or a glass of wine to end the night. Met lots of interesting people from other countries. It felt like a very safe hotel. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very NIce!”
Reviews.Author: LWTraveler
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel des Artistes! It was very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was good and the roof top terrace was great in the morning and at night! Our only complaints were that we did not get a wake up call on the last day (we were late getting to the airport) and the night reception person wasn't the nicest person. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: SClayton
Reviews.Content: Some of the other reviewers are so fussy! A beautiful hotel not far from Rome train station. Although it wasn't near any sights, it is minutes away from the Metro and the train station so no probs getting around. The staff were friendly and helpful; breakfast very nice. It has a lovely roof garden which affords no great views but is nice to eat breakfast in the sunshine or enjoy a drink from the beer late at night. We stayed in a room which was in an annexe which did mean going up and down in tiny lifts (reception is on the fifth floor?), but the room was lovely. Good air con, good decorations. We loved this hotel, we thought it was classy considering the price. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, but credit card verification policy is a problem ...”
Reviews.Author: otterpop
Reviews.Content: We showed up in Rome at about noon and walked the five blocks to the hotel. We got up the five floors in the elevator and were told by the desk person that they didn't have our room for the first of three nights because they couldn't verify our credit card. This is one of their written policies (that they check credit cards a few days before the guest is to arrive to hold a reservation). They had sent us an e-mail, but since we were already on our trip, we didn't receive it. We ended up finding another hotel right around the corner that could take us in a quad room for 3 consecutive nights so we went there. I'm sure Hotel Des Artistes was a nice place. Their front desk personnel were very apologetic and said they'd try to find us a room for the first night and then allow us to move over for the last two nights into the quad room. They didn't charge us for anything so we walked away satisfied. I guess a word to the wise, make sure you check your e-mails while you're on your trip in case this happens to you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you like staying over a Vespa repair shop...”
Reviews.Author: mdbarbagallo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 10-day honeymoon at the Hotel des Artistes. Initially, we were very excited because the hotel was very clean, was just a few blocks form the train station, and was stone's throw from Internet cafes, restaurants, a grocery store, and shops. The room itself was like a closet, but that was to be expected because I know that rooms in Europe are traditionally smaller than those in the states. Overall, our experience was good, although we stopped getting the wake-up calls we requested two days into our trip (we instead bought an alarm clock, and all was well). We finally assumed it was because they were upset with us for fogetting to take the "DO Not Disturb" sign off the door...they can't clean your room if they do that, and they get upset if you go to the desk and ask for new towels and toilet paper. The breakfast buffet was pretty darn good for a hotel - cereal, hard boiled eggs, bread, coffee, some type of juice drink, canned fruit, yogurt, cheese, and sliced deli ham. The room had dark, thick curtains but was DIRECTLY above a Vespa repair shop, meaning that our room constantly smelled of exhaust and was filled with the sounds of revving motors. This was nonstop ALL DAY EVERY DAY! Needless to say, that didn't exactly make for the most romantic of honeymoons! Overall, for the money, this was a great bargain, but it wasn't as nice as it was made out to be on the hotel's web site. I would recommend it to bargain hunters, but not to anyone looking for a romantic getaway (lesson learned...) Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel - Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JoBushy
Reviews.Content: I've recently returned from a long weekend at Hotel des Artistes. Overall I found the hotel very good value and close to Termini station, which proved extremely handy as this is where our coach pulled in from Ciampino airport. I have read some reviews that Termini can be an insalubrious area, however, I didn't have any problems and was quite happy to walk around at night time without feeling itimiated. I found the hotel room exceptionally clean with good facilities including a televsion, mini fridge, hair dryer (very useful!) and clean towels daily. If I have to make any negative comments I'd say the room was a tad on the small side and also the walls were thin - I woke up in the middle of the night a couple of times due to the noise from neighbours next door checking out and I'm a heavy sleeper!. Breakfast was basic but fairly substantial and comprised of a continental selection of crossaints, cheese, ham, yoghurt and fruit. There was also fruit juice and coffee and tea on tap. I would recommend this hotel to any budget travellers, it is definitely one of the cheaper options I found in Rome and is close to the station and main tourist sites (about a 15 minute walk to the centre). Also, I'd like to recommend the lovely restaurant; Bistro that gives 20% off to those staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we thought...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to Rome,but our first to this hotel. We were a little worried but it was pretty good. The reception scenerio was a bit strange with the lifts but you get used to it. Our room was not in the main buildind but next door.The room was small but clean and comfy.The breakfast is quite poor but we didn't expect much more. The location is very near the station and in a safe area. It is definetly value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5-year old daughter and I stayed at the Hotel Des Artistes for 2 nights in May 2006. We were a little concerned when we initially arrived, as there's no reception when you walk in; it's like entering an apartment building. You have to take the funky elevator to the 5th floor to check in. However, we were nicely surprised to receive a lovely family room which was clean and well decorated (although like most hotel rooms in Rome, it was not very large). The beds were a bit hard, but that's the only negative regarding the room. The hotel also has a wonderful airtight window system, so there was no noise from the street. Breakfast was not spectacular, but certainly an acceptable way to start your day. There is a nice rooftop garden as well. While the hotel is technically in the Termini Station district, we never felt unsafe walking around in the area. Overall, this is a nice budget traveler's hotel that we would certainly consider staying in again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a safe neighborhood within walking distance (15-20 mins) to the tourist sites. The complimentary breakfast and rooftop garden were wonderful. We would certainly stay here again. - P.O, USA

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Ev.M.A
Reviews.Content: Nothing to do with their photos on the web. Reception on the 5th floor of an old building, with the smallest and older lift you can imagine (no room for the suitcases, so start working out to carry them up the stairs!). Rooms were ok but in the annexe building two doors from hotel. Breakfast was really bad, cheap cereals and bad coffee. Central, but careful when walking near Termini! The best? Bistro restaurant, around the corner from the hotel. I would definitely not go back to Les Artistes.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good!!”
Reviews.Author: smgtreker
Reviews.Content: Not a place I would stay in again, the area was very dodgy! When I booked, I specified that I wanted two beds, and when we arrived there was only one, when speaking to the people at the hotel desk, we were basically told to deal with it! Then, when actually staying in the room, which I paid for ensuite, there was no hot water!!! I complained on the first day, which we were told it would be sorted and on the day we left, it still wasn't done! Probably the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, spend a little extra and upgrade to a better one!

Reviews.Title: “Des Artistes Rates OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, the last night of our two week stay, so we could be within walking distance of Termini, for an early Fiumincino express out the airport, to catch our 9am flight back to the States. The hotel was a little farther than we had hoped, with the walk being the equivalent of about six city blocks, but it wasn't too bad. I didn't feel it was in the safest part of town, though - and Rome is especially known for it burglay of tourists, especially around Termini. The accomodations were OK, although the room was so small, I could hardly make it around my large luggage to my side of the bed. Also, the elevator wasn't working at 5:30am, so we had to lug our luggage down three flights of stairs (another tip: pack lightly for any trip to Europe - you'll save yourself some blood, sweat and tears). On the bright side, the AC was more than adequate, and this is not always a given at other hotels. Overall, Des Artistes barely met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “very authentic”
Reviews.Author: b_ladLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: we booked quite last minute and so we were running out of choice for places to stay. we read some good reviews on this hotel and hence we booked it. it is abit different in the sense that the reception is on the 5th floor. however, it was clean, friendly, good service, good breakfast and very close to the main train station/metro. the decor was very authentic - keeping with the theme of artists. we didn't experience any problems during our 3 nights there.

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a budget hotel this place has it all! Certainly, it can not be compared with first class lodging, but I had a more than lovely, clean and beutifully appointed room with private marble bath. The room was equipped with a small well disguised refrigertor. (housed in a period piece of furniture). The fifth floor lobby was small, but fit the needs of the establishment. I never found the establishment noisy, and we stayed for five nights. They offered a discount for cash payment and had wonderful suggestions for outstanding dining in the area. I am no stranger to travel in Italy, and this was truly charming and typical of an Italian family hotel. The roof terrace provided a lovely place to have morning coffee, evening drinks or take in the sun. The location, though near the station is very safe and not in the typical questionable portion of the area. The station location makes travel throughout the city easy and transfer to the airport via public transportation is easy and affordable. No taxis needed here. I would definetely return as would my family.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Basic”
Reviews.Author: Robo610
Reviews.Content: We stayed the three nights over Easter, yes the rooms are clean and basic but what more would you want for the price ? Breakfast was ok, but watch out for the lift doors they have a mind of their own... They have a rooftop terrace for the smokers, you could also take a nightcap up from the bar ( this as well as the reception are located on the 5th floor ) Only 5 minutes walk from the Termini, even less to the nearest Metro ... but be warned about the pickpockets and if you don't like confined spaces stay away from the Metro, although everything is in walking distance. We would not hesitate in recommending this small and friendly hotel ... enjoy your stay in Rome and enjoy this hotel ..ERIC

Reviews.Title: “Why the glowing reviews?”
Reviews.Author: mobiblu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after appraising advice from the usually very reliable trip advisor reviews. Unfortunately our stay fell short of expectations. On the first night our room was permeated with an overwhelming, nauseating smell of drains. We brought it to the staff's attention the following morning (not wishing to disturb them that night) and were advised that the problem would be looked at. Eight hours later, on a flying visit to the hotel between excursions, we spoke to the staff again, and were reassured that the maintenance man was as we spoke looking at the problem. However that night... smell still there. The woman at reception was very pleasant but unable to offer any solutions until the next morning, aside from emptying half a can of air freshener ( mandarin) into the bathroom - not so good if you are asthmatic, like me. The next day the drains were treated with bleach, so that night we were overwhelmed with the smell of chlorine! We were not happy campers at all. To add the cherry on top, that night my sister got her bag stolen. We were eating outside at the restaurant immedatiately around the corner from the hotel, at the junction of Via Villafranca and Via Vincenza. Without going into details I would strongly advise any trip advisor members to avoid that particular establishement! And the receptionist on that night at the hotel was less than helpful. Overall the room was small and very dark, with little natural light. It was however clean. The breakfast was unexceptional but late-comers be warned! My sister arrived about 1 minute after the end of breakfast, food still on the buffet table and hotel guests clearly in evidence and she had to endure a telling off from the lady in charge! We unfortunately did not share the wonderful customer support that other travellers have experienced and guide books would lead one to expect. But hey, Rome itself is great! Culture, history, food fabulous. Maybe just try another hotel and definitely avoid that bistro!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: Vic_Smith
Reviews.Content: We had a family room at Des Artistes for three nights in April and were very pleased with the hotel, staff and level of accommodation provided. It's easy to find from the Termini and is a typical old European 'budget' hotel, and to my mind much better than any Holiday Inn. Travelling as a family (Mum & Dad, + 16 and 13 year olds) the family room represented good value (couldn't find many available in Rome) and it got a 'thumbs up' from all of us. Breakfasts were good and set us up for the day. The lift was great fun (once you'd figured it out) and is a great way to get to meet other guests!! If our coin in the Trevi works, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the room for my family of 5 based on comments and recommendations on tripadvisor.com. This is a great hotel 5 blocks from Roma Termini. The walk on Via Vicenza was very safe (many hotels and restaurants and tourists at all hours) and the recommended restaurant was fantastic. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Well Placed”
Reviews.Author: Tiggs20
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a group of 7 women and had a 4 bed and 3 bed room. Both rooms were well proprotioned with good size bathrooms. Ive paid more for smaller and less well dressed rooms. We would recommend the hotel. Breakfast was continental but more than adequate. There was free internet access provided. Late check in was also not a problem. The lift up to Reception on the 5th floor is a howl a minute! The staff were relatively helpful when one suitcase failed to turn up for more than 24hrs. Only downside were that the floors are tiles so you could hear some noise above from walking about and there was the occasional noisy neighbour but not so loud as to keep you awake if youre a light sleeper. Then again based on using the lift we must have made a right racket coming in at 1.30am!! Would definately recommend this hotel based on comfort, location (the metro was round the corner with Termini 1 stop away) and value for money. Check this one out before you book somewhere expensive on a 3***. We paid £20-25 a night. Claire Kerrigan, Kat Coy, Hannah Maughan, Alyson Luxon, Alison Greer, Alison Swift, Jazz Kaur Olak.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we would recommend the hotel to any of our friends,very convenient for the metro and local restaurants and pubs. ideal for parties to watch the rugby!! richard terry england

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop terrace sets this place apart”
Reviews.Author: Claire.oconnell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three friends in a Hostel Quad room on the 5th floor, as we wanted to avoid the hectic 10-20 per room bunk bed scenario and valued a little privacy, for a very reasonable price. We had a great time. The room was clean and comfortable and serviced every day with clean towels etc. Having your own sink and hair dryer in the room was handy, but best of all was the wall safe, being able to leave our valuables and passports in such a secure place gave us great piece of mind. Bathrooms were regularly cleaned and perfectly acceptable. The lovely roof-top terrace was the very best thing about this place, perfect for whiling away an evening with a bottle of wine. We found the area in which the hotel is situated to be safe and convenient. For what we paid we got much more than we expected, would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very, very pleasantly surprised by this place. Friendly staff with very good English; excellent, clean and airy room complete with colonial style fan and shutters; even a selection of games available if you ever get bored of your companion! Close to the station and about a 15 minute walk into the middle of town which might put some off but there are many worse places to walk around than Rome, and it proved a good way or working off some of the pizza. Plus it's right on top of a Metro station if walking doesn't appeal. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “We found the hotel convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really liked the friendly atmosphere at Hotel des Artistes. The staff were always helpful and spoke to us fluently in English. We found the hotel convenient to transport and we enhoyed the good breakfasts to start each day in beautiful Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with comfortable rooms for a great price and in a great location. I've stayed there a few times and have recommended it to everyone I know going to Rome. J.S. in the United States

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sbc2556
Reviews.Content: There were two positive things about this hotel, which I'll state, but the negatives severely outweigh them. The rooms and property itself is of very good construction and there are beautiful marble floors and appointments. The free breakfast is certainly sufficient for the purpose. That said, the reception, breakfast and "bar" are on the fifth floor of the main building and is a tremendous inconvenience. I'm used to small elevators in Europe, but to have to lug luggage up and down it and use it to get to breakfast or other things during the stay was just not acceptable, in my opinion. We were in the annex, as so many others have mentioned, so that made the trips to the reception/breakfast all the more inconvenient. The "bar" consisted of a refrigerator with beer, bottled water and wine. If you thought to ask, they'd sell you something from it. Otherwise, there is not really a bar there, just the tables that are used for breakfast and the refrigerator... this really seems to stretch the concept, in my opinion. The breakfast area also was not large enough for the number of guests and was basically as hot as an oven in the middle of December. I could not imagine being there in the summer. The attitude and helpfulness of the staff was very inconsistent. They'd be very helpful with some things and be completely weird about others, such as the time I had to explain to the man at the reception that I had not received a map from anyone when I checked in. He questioned me about it as if I were a ten year old or was hoarding them to sell on the black market! Once he was convinced, he handed me the map and gave somewhat incorrect directions to the Villa Borghese; which he said was a 15 minute walk and turned out to be more like 45, due to his spotty directions and the actual distance. Also, my traveling companion lost most of her electricity and phone service on our last night there. When she went over to report it, they basically thanked her and did not even attempt to correct it. There were lots of back-packing 20 something year olds here and it hit me that this was precisely the issue. This should not be advertised as a hotel but a hostel. It's probably perfectly adequate for someone expecting a hostel-like environment, but not a professional, experienced traveler, who's used to some basic conveniences. I'd never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but beware the "switch" to the annexe!”
Reviews.Author: silverwrxmike
Reviews.Content: I booked two nights in the main building and specifically asked for, and paid more for, the main building as I was travelling with my young son who felt safer there. I was told upon arrival that I would have to change to the annexe the second night. I was not pleased, but I didn't let it ruin our stay. What upset me was the fact that the annexe has a cheaper nightly rate which was not offered to me and in fact when I asked about it, they said it was the same rate as the main building. I knew better after seeing the rate on the internet prior to our arrival, so I finally found an English-speaking receptionist and she confirmed the price difference. They reluctantly refunded my over-payment. I can honestly say that the hotel is great value for money, spotlessly clean with beautiful bathrooms and furnishings. It is only spoiled by the deceitful nature of at least one, or possibly more, of the management. I therefore cannot recommend this hotel and will not stay there when I return to Rome in a few months with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Sleepbabysleep
Reviews.Content: Following the reviews from this site, I booked this hotel. The staff were made aware four weeks prior, reconfirmation two weeks and one day before I travelled that I was visiting with an infant, would be arriving late and requested a quiet room. When I arrived (at 10.45p.m.) I was informed there "was a problem with the room" as you can imagine I was not impressed. I was shown a hotel round the corner which was not a hotel but a pensione, three flights up and disgusting. As it was so late I had no alternative but to accept the hell hole. I would strongly advise anyone visiting this hotel to have a back up plan. As I did not, will definately NOT be booking this hotel again. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhc71
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Hotel Des Artistes; we would recommend this hotel and will stay here if we ever visit Rome again. Rachel C., UK

Reviews.Title: “everything was really excellent and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you stumble onto this hotel/hostel online, have no fear about what you will find! It is one block from a Metro station, walking distance to most sights, everything was really excellent and clean, and the staff was top notch. We will definitely be staying here again! Brian S. France/USA

Reviews.Title: “verbally assaulted by staffmember”
Reviews.Author: GeneOkerlund
Reviews.Content: I was verbally assaulted by male member of staff for chnging my mind about booking a tour after finding out it was 12 euros more than advertised. He glared at me from the start as i approached the desk, didnt say a word and was very reluctant to help me in the first place. After I changed my mind his rudeness turned to anger as he literally launched into a tirade accusing me of wasting my time and making him look bad. I left the hotel feeling shaken, humiliated and afraid to go back to collect my luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a city break to Rome for my mum's birthday as a surprise through lastminute!! There were plenty of reasonably priced hotels on the website so i used tripadvisor to pick the one with the best reviews. I decided on HOTEL DES ARTISTES and crossed my fingers and hoped for the best!! Well, it was fantastic - no problems at all and the staff were absolutely fantastic!! It is well situated - 5 mins from the main termini of Rome - plenty of trains, buses and taxi's to all parts of the city!! When we got into the hotel i did take other posters' advice and leave mum downstairs with luggage as i legged it up 5 floors to the reception to book in - (god knows why i didn't take the lift!!) We were on the second floor and it was definately a quiet room which was decorated tastefully and very comfortable. The room had it's own bathroom (shower, loo and sink - it also had a hairdryer on there too!) It had an electronic safe, fridge and TV!! (Channel 16 was a dvd channel and each day another DVD was played continually and usually in English - not that we watched much tv but it was handy for something to watch whilst waiting to use the bathroom!!) Via Villafranca is a quiet road with a small bar opposite - lovely people in there - we bought a bottle of wine and they opened it for us - it's not often tourists bring cork screws away with them!! We took the bottle up to the hotel roof terrace, which is lovely by the way - great to sit up there in the evening and meet plenty of new peeps from all over the world!! By the way - breakfast was crossaints, bread, ham, cheese - cereal, yoghurt and fruit - juice and tea/coffee!! It was all fresh and tasted great first thing in the morning - staff were really helpful and spoke fantastic English which meant i didn't have to refer to the phrase book evey 2mins!! All in all it was great - much better than i ever thought it would be - we would definately go there again!! And if you're after a cheap place to eat with food that is better than the more plush restaurants - try AL 39, it's just around the corner from the hotel and it was always full of Italians - therefore it had to be good!! We were definately right - the pasta is homemade along with everything else on the menu!!! It really was out of this world!! AL 39 is just off via Palestro and it's great!! Hope your stay in Rome is as good as ours was!!! Cheers Michelle

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: l0is1ane
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. We stayed in a twin room in the annex which is just next door to the main hotel. What was great was that the hotel had a personality - it wasn't your bog standard holiday-inn type place - it felt very Italian. The room was spotless with a flat screen tv and perfectly good bathroom. There was some noise from the street in the mornings as they were digging up the road outside, but it didn't bother me. The rooms were cleaned daily and there was a free safe in the room. Be advised that you have to leave 10 Euro deposit for your key which is refunded when you leave. The location is great - a very short walk from Termini station, although note the metro is hardly the ideal way to travel around the city as it only circles the city, it doesn't go through it. One small piece of advice - if you arrive on the Terravision bus from the airport check when it goes back before you get off the bus as there is no information anywhere on the schedule and we missed our bus back because we had no idea when it went back!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Alicattrimmer
Reviews.Content: Overall, our three night stay at Hotel Des Artistes was very enjoyable, but not as good as hoped. On the plus side, the reception staff were generally very friendly and helpful, but there had been a problem with our booking and we were only able to stay in the room we'd booked in the main building for one night. This room was large and clean but sound insulation was poor (woken at 6.30am by TV in another room). Breakfast was ok, but not worth 12 euros. We then moved to the annexe which is several streets away in a rather secluded area - bit of a worry for 2 females alone! Again the room and shared bathroom were spotlessly clean, and the staff came to our rescue almost immediately by providing a hairdryer!! The hotel location is handy for arriving and leaving Rome, but not so much for getting around, especially in the evening when the area around the Termini feels somewhat unsafe. Rome itself is beautiful and fascinating, just take sensible shoes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights here and found the staff very helpful and friendly. Location was brilliant as you are about 10 minutes from the Termini bus and train station and you have a Metro stop just around the corner. We stayed in The Annex (which based on other reviews I imagined was a long way from the hotel ) but was just next door. A good idea when you are checking in (as the reception is on the 5th floor and the lift is tiny) is for one person to check in and leave the other(s) with the bags downstairs. A member of staff will then show you to your room and how to use the keys etc. The rooms were clean and reasonable in size with a good size bathroom. Breakfast was fine nothing to write home about and we did find there was a lot of traffic noise at night (our room was at the front). Also the internet access is not currently available. I was worried about the area as it was near the Termini (it's actually about 5 blocks away) but it was very safe and we either walked or used the bus or metro (even late at night). Never any need to pay for Taxis. . I would definitely recommend this hotel as good value for money and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Non-Smoking Rooms Outside Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: One of the very few non-smoking hotels in Rome and located less than 10 minutes away from the Termini Station. Nice staff and great rooms with pretty furnishings (nice curtains, bedspreads, etc.). Our room was located in a private building that overlooked a cement courtyard which was much prettier than it sounds. Only complaint were the floors of the rooms and hallways are all tile, therefore it can be very noisy at 8:30 in the morning with the maids coming and going. Also might recommend some WD-40 for the doors of the elevator (they are very squeaky and you could hear the doors open and shut all the way in to our bedroom). Definitley worth the reasonable cost.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in rome”
Reviews.Author: scot1
Reviews.Content: we stayed in one of the hotel rooms here 10-12 sept, 2 adults & 1 child. hotel is a 5 minute walk from termini station, we arrived at 10.30pm - it was a perfectly safe area, felt fine walking around there. the room was great - doudle bedroom for us , big bathroom & seperate living room area that had a bed for kiddo with her own tv too. Breakfast was good - cereals, yoghurt, rolls meat, cheese , croissants etc. I really loved the roof terrace for sitting with a drink before dinner & the 2 restaurants the hotel gave us cards for were in the next street & good too. I would definetely go back again

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good value for money hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Michael Russell
Reviews.Content: Our rooms and beds were very comfortable. They were also very quiet which helped us get a good nights sleep after a long day sightseeing. Roof terrace was a haven to enjoy the sun, breakfast, pre dinner drinks and nightcaps! Would definitely recommend this hotel and we will be back! Michael Russell Northern Ireland 31st August 2005

Reviews.Title: “The hotel has a friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a friendly atmosphere. Located very near the main line station and bus services, making it easy to travel around Rome and see the sites. Room Maid was very polite and pleasant throughout our stay. User friendly for English speaking guests. R & VK UK

Reviews.Title: “Problems with deposit for the keys”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our group of 18 peolpe stayed in the hotel in April 2005. We had rooms both in the hotel (highest floor) and in the youth hostel (2nd floor). We had a very bad experience with the personnel from the reception. At arrival we were asked to pay 10EURO for each key as a deposit. We aked if we could get a receipt for the deposit but we were said that they usually do not do this, because every client gets the deposit when giving back the key. At departure the receptionist refused to give us 10 EURO for each key arguing that we had paid no money for the keys. We insisted that we get our money back, but we were called thieves and social misfits. I don´t know if my review will be posted on this page. I only want to prevent others from a similar unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: vicfish
Reviews.Content: We were a little scared, arriving at Ciampino about midnight from Teesside, about transport into the city, but we had booked the shuttle bus on the internet, so, no problemo. It was 8 minutes on foot from Termini station. We found the room to be clean and comfortable. We had expected traffic noise all night, but it was as quiet as the grave. The reception staff were very helpful (in English) and the breakfast was fine, especially when we went up to the roof terrace. We stayed in touch with home via the internet on the hotel PC's. As a base for exploring Rome, it is excellent. All the transport is available at Termini, and it isn't far past there on foot to the Colosseum and the Forum. If you want food for a picnic, there's a food store in the lower level at Termini at the entrance nearest to the hotel. We had a super time in Rome, and would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful noise and no espresso”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Des Artistes: The hotel seems all right for the price you pay ( 125 euro cash). But on the first day the receptionist asked us ( me and my friend, a double room) to pay the price ahead for four nights. I never was used to pay ahead for a hotel, but all right.. Better was to book and experience the first night. If it was okay, then you book and pay also for the other three nights. First the first time ( this was not a business trip) I thrusted somebody in a new town.. The receptionist, somebody who didn't seem to know much about Rome ( he didn't know certain restaurants) a male obviously coming from the United States, led us to the ground floor where somebody should pick us up to show us the room in the annex building. Nobody came, after I grabbed the phone.. the American receptionist came down. He led us to the annex building, four blocks further! It didn't have the looks of a hotel, more an appartment building where a lot of construction work was going on. It was extremely noisy. The whole day. Maybe that was the reason to pay the price ahead.. anyway we thougt to give them a chance. Besides we left the hotel every morning at ten to return at ten in the evening. No bother with that construction work.. unless they started at 7.30 u - 8.00 u AM already. Two times they woke us up very early ( we went to bed around two 'o clock AM) and we made our complaints at the staff. They tried to arrange a discount via the manager, but that wasn't so easy.. the manager wasn't always in the hotel. Finally, he gave us a discount of 50 euro on the total amount of 510 euro. It was arranged by a friendly receptionist the last night of our staying in the hotel. He phoned the manager. That was a very nasty thing in Hotel des Artistes. The main problem was that they didn't tell it before I booked the room and not before I payed the 510 euro's in cash. And that's not very polite. It looks even like cheating. Further information: The elevator is too small. If you go inside with more then two people it is as if you're making love or trying to make love with all the elevator occupants. The breakfast is so so.. the bread is all right, but there is no espresso, and we are in Italy! The coffee is bad and tasted like american coffee ( more like tasty dark water) And they serve no fresh orange juice in a country where the orange grow on trees.. The roof terrace on the other hand is very nice. But again: why no isolation for the airconditioner? The streetnoise is less then the airco. So if you sit at the streetside on the terrace then it's more quiet. The rooms are clean and tasteful, the airco works all right, there is a safe locker. But no bath tub ( not possible in a small bathroom) and the rooms are extreme small. The view is terrible, you can close the curtains the whole day because the only thing we saw was a blind wall. Anyhow, with all that construction work going on: we left most of the time and tried to see somethinh of that beautiful city: Rome. Hotel des Artistes: I would never go back there.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I greatly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Des Artistes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I greatly enjoyed our stay at Hotel Des Artistes. It was the first hotel we stayed in during our holiday in Italy, and was one of our favorites. Our room was perfect, and the staff was extremely helpful and nice. Des Artistes is a comfortable, clean and friendly hotel at a very reasonable rate. We give the hotel our highest recommendation. - L & N Klocek USA

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The noise level in the hotel was totally unacceptable. Artistes fail to mention that they have large bunk rooms with beds at €20 a night next to rooms at €150. At those prices one should expect a degree of comfort and quiet. It was like trying to sleep through an all night party with people shouting and banging on doors, including ours, for 2 consequetive nights. The lift is also quite noisy as it has two sets of doors which slam shut. The reception is on the 5th floor and consequently the lift is used 24/7, however that was the least of our problems. They insisted that we pay up front on arrival, which we found most unusual. We moved hotels for the last two nights and had problems getting them to agree a refund those nights. We asked for a refund for one of the nights which we had not slept at all but were refused. Locally, Artistes is regarded as a Hostel not an Hotel, the decorative quality of our room reflected that, the paintwork was old - the walls were very scuffed and the door catch broke off when we tried to close it. All this in the main hotel, not the annex! €150 a night buys you a heck of a lot more in most places.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Frightening...”
Reviews.Author: shjw
Reviews.Content: I concur with the last entry. I don't expect anything fabulous from a budget room, either, except cleanliness and safety. I did not get it here. We were pleased when we entered the reception area of the main building only to find out that we had to walk, alone with our bags at 2:00 AM, to a building about a block away. We were given subpar directions, but found the not-so-clean room with little problems (luckily, the room was dark so we could not inspect the cleanliness too much). If I was not with my husband, I would have left as soon as I saw our dark, sparse hallway. We were sharing a bathroom with 4 other rooms but it at least looked clean. The walls were also amazingly thin so our plans to rest the next morning were foiled. My advice is that you can find much better for the price, or stay in the main building!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Annex!!!”
Reviews.Author: kex
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I have travelled quite extensively and don't expect miracles for budget accomodation (This is considered budget for Rome!) However this place is the second worst Hotel I have ever stayed in. (Mid-April 2004) We were booked in at the Main Hotel only to be shuffled down the road by a young American lad who couldn't wait to dissappear after he had show us our room in 'the annex'. We understood his eagerness to get away when we realised we were 4 sharing a bathroom instead of the agreed 2. After our early riser neighbours had gone, the bathroom looked as though a bomb had hit it! We also had an elderly gentleman hammering on metal shelving for hours in a cupboard next to our room when we arrived, after 10 hours travelling. It was a nightmare! We complained when a young girl turned up with yet another family ready to share 'the annex'. They refused the room after looking around, with their youngest childs departing words 'Mummy, get me out of this place'. The only reason we agreed to stay was because almost everybody had gone for our last 2 nights, and the annex is closer to town. The morning we were leaving I went to the Main hotel to collect my 10 Euro deposit for the door card only to find it had been removed from the plastic sleeve. After a blazing row at 5.30 in the morning with the night man, he gave me the 10 Euros from another customers sleeve. The Termini Station area in general is full of undesireables and if you can, stay clear of it. Although I have to admit, we never encountered any problems. On the plus side, there was always plenty of hot water, the rooms were kept clean and were freshly painted, but I'm afraid it didn't make up for the short-comings. Having said all that it didn't spoil my overall enjoyment in the wonderful, beatiful city of Rome. Definetley a must for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I vistied Rome and Hotel Des Artistes in March 2005 for 5 nights. The hotel was in a great location only 5 blocks from the main train station, The staff was friendly for the most part, the room was nice, and the terrace on the top was a great spot to relax. The hotel offers free internet which was a plus. Overall I felt the hotel was nice and a great value! Brandon USA

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed our Time in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TVHottman
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Hotel des Artistes during the week of Thanksgiving (Nov. 21-29). We had a twin room (two twin beds) in the Annex portion of the hotel. Overall, we very much enjoyed our stay! The staff was very accomodating with our requests and questions. They often seemed tired after long shifts at the desk, but they were very helpful. If you didn't bring your own alarm clock, I strongly suggest using the wake up call service. It is computerized and never late or forgotten! The room was VERY tiny, but when in Rome you don't spend much time in your hotel room! The bathrooms were awesome. Very nice size with marble showers. Walking from the Annex to the main hotel (4 doors down) was never a bother for us. The free internet service and the daily breakfast are well worth it. It does take some time for the only elevator to pick you up and it is extremely small (4 persons max), but we enjoyed meeting folks from all around the world who were visiting Rome while waiting for the elevator. We did get lost trying to get from the Termini to the hotel on the first night that we arrived, but once you get that figured out, the location is top notch. If I ever get to go back, this hotel will be where I'll stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, quiet, good breakfast on the roof of the hotel Rooms are clean and confortable Near from the train station and the subway station Very helpful people at the reception! A very nice hotel in Roma

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was strange in that the reception was on the top floor and you had to go up in a rickety lift. Attention - due to the stairs, the hotel would not be suitable for baby bugys or those in wheel chairs. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was large with an ensuite (I gather some rooms have communual facilities). The room was well furnished, and even though it overlooked the street it was not noisy. The breakfast, that was included with the room price was a buffet. Not bad - you could certainly fill yourself up for the morning. The breakfast room was a bit small - not sure how it would have coped at peak holiday time. The hotel offered free internet facilities - which was really uesful. However, it did seem to be hogged by certain people who obviously could not give up e-mail for a few days! (no super-power, english speaking nations mentioned!) The hotel was 15 minutes walk from the central station (Termni) and about 20mins from the attractions. The nearest metro station was about 8 mins walk away. Stayed here in November 2004 and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A good value”
Reviews.Author: NJTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in November '04 - our first trip to Europe. We were directed (the clerk could not leave the desk) to the annex building and marched up a number of stairs, carrying our own bags. I had to ask a cleaning girl for my room location and ended up climbing another flight of stairs. The building had an awful smell in it and we had to sleep with the window open that night. The smell subsided the next day, but never fully went away. Other than that, the room was clean, but a bit dark. The breakfast they offered was nice, as was the free intenet access at night in the converted breakfast room. (It offers drinks at a reasonable price after breakfast). There was a decent rooftop deck, but being November, we did not get to use it. The neighborhood is very commercial in apperance, 5 blocks from Termini Station. In the U.S. I would compare this to a Super 8, but with smaller showers and no elevator, (not uncommon in Rome). I understand the main building has a "lift". For the money, it was a good value. If that is your first criteria then this is a good choice. We spent a little more money and stayed near the Spanish Steps later in the week, which we preferred - a lot. For us, the savings were not worth the difference in our "Rome experience" and we would not stay in the Termini area again.

Reviews.Title: “Come to the Hotel des Artistes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're visiting Rome for the first time, Hotel des Artistes is the place for you. The staff there was friendly, warm, and extremely helpful. You will truly feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fine, location OK, Streets outside hotel -sleazy...”
Reviews.Author: pineahead
Reviews.Content: Room itself was clean and comfortable. Staff was pretty friendly , breakfast was really nice (for Europe). We spent a boatload on taxis as it is far 8-10 euro cab ride to any of the sites. Street outside hotel was dirty and junky.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly as advertised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at the Hotel Des Artistes Oct.-Nov. 2004. We booked this hotel off the internet from Hotel last February, 10 months before our arrival. We paid $1313.00 for 8 nights. The Hotel Des Artistes price and description of the hotel and room as a three star property was consistent with other properties listed. However we were booked into an annex next to the main building, in the sister hotel known as Carlitos Way, which is a two star property. Apparently the price we paid did not earn us a stay at the Hotel Des Artistes but, this was not mentioned in the Hotel advertisement. Our room was very clean but, was on the third floor, (they say 2nd as they don't count the ground floor as one but as zero.) There was no elevator available to us at Carlitos Way. The elevator is reserved for residents who live on the upper floors of the hotel. In addition, you have to buzz for admission to your hotel room corridor. This was not always answered promptly. It became annoying when we returned to our room not only to climb two flights of stairs, but then wait to be buzzed into our room. Our room had very minimal storage for your clothes, so we lived out of a suitcase for 8 days. We did have internet service available at the main building. The roof terrace and our breakfast was included again at the main building. My complaint was that the ad in Hotel was very misleading as they did not mention the annex. We were led to believe that our room would be in the Hotel Des Artistes. The hotel location was good, but we would not stay there again. It was not what we thought we paid for. Had we known we needed to pay more for the main hotel, we would have been able to make a decision on staying there or booking another hotel. You could not pay the difference to upgrade once we were there. The staff was very cordial but it does not make up for the inconviences of being in the annex.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy common bath in les Artistes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am not a fussy customer but the level of cleanliness of the common bath on floor 5 is just terrible. we booked room 507 (with common bath) which is only separated from the bath by a tiny wall. The toilet is virtually in use all night next to being in an unacceptable condition. 2 complaints at the reception yielded only ignorant smiles. I am very disappointed and surprised by the rather good feedback other guests have had (is 507 just the worst room?) Best regards th

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, ok neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: DustinT12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights (the Hotel, not the Hostel) and paid 110 Euros/night. The room was neat, clean and fairly spacious for European standards. Housekeeping did a nice job. Staff was friendly. Breakfasts were good too. Only complaint is that it is somewhat far removed from the "action" of Rome. A 5 minute walk to the Termini (which is a bit of a nightmare in itself), or a 25 minute walk to the Ancient City, or a 10 Euro cab ride to the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Not that near the train station”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I rolled the dice and booked this hotel online based on its description as being near Termini. It was actually several long blocks away. Still walking distance but those blocks can feel veeerry long at the end of a whole day of sightseeing on your feet. Also, reception is on the 5th floor and the lift does not work half the time. Climbing up those flights with even a small suitcase will get your heart pumping. Pros are the friendly staff (the guy who showed me to my room was from San Fran?!) and the charming and clean rooms. Good coffee. All in all, a fair deal but makes me curious about those similarly priced hotels right next to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: soneca16
Reviews.Content: Ok so the place is cheap and really, really clean, there's also internet access, and it's close to the train station and the supermarket. If you're not having breakfast at the hotel, they give you coupons for a cafe accross the street, it's really good. However, the staff is a little snotty and not really willing to help you out with information-- we wanted to go to the movies and they were reluctant to help us figure out the bus system, but they gave us a map. We stayed there for a week, out of that week, 2 nights we couldn't sleep well b/c of the loud parties going on in rooms on the floor. If you want to save money, and have a place to sleep, this is the place for you. Great for the broke college backpacker/sightseer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: saintmirren
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for station, safe comfortable environment. Rooms beautifully appointed and clean .Staff welcoming and helpful. Denis & Sheila Droy Scotland, U.K.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great location. Clean, large comfortable room. Hotel staff very friendly, helpful and most of them spoke english! Breakfast was great. Rooftop terrace a nice touch. Great location. Only drawback was the very tiny, slow elevator. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “an extremely disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: sleepaway
Reviews.Content: security is very lax. my purse was stolen in the 5th floor breakfast room. the attitude of the staff was that this couldn't be true (although one person at the desk did help me get numbers to cancel the credit card, ATM card and the one missing travelers check! the staff took no care in monitoring access to the breakfast room or adjacent reception area. we were given a room in the "annex" a 3rd floor walkup situation in an adjacent building (quite inconvenient). when we returned for the last night before our flight home (only because our room had been prepaid through Travelocity), it took them an hour and a half to get us into a room in a comedy of errors that had them moving our bags three times from one building to the other. when we got to our room our bags were in it and the door to the room was standing open. The hotel seems to include a dorm or hostel arrangement that contributes to a great deal of traffic and confusion around the reception and breakfast areas. There are video cameras that don't record and from our observation no one seems to monitor them when buzzing people in from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place - Close to Train Station”
Reviews.Author: Treez
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not the cheapest in the area but you get a decent room and facilities and friendly, helpful staff. It's close to the central train station and is therefore a transport "hub" with regular metro and bus services. It's a fair (15-20 mins) walk into the key areas though not unpleasant. Our room was not in the main building but one of the adjacent buildings. The room was small but sufficient - decent but not roomy by UK standards. Breakfast is a pretty standard (buffet) affair and there's a nice roof terrace for and evening bottle of wine...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad if you're a college kid trekking through europe....”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkJoe
Reviews.Content: The place is ok if you're a college kid backpacking through europe, but if you're over 25 and looking to stay at a nice hotel in Rome, you should look elsewhere. The room was nice, but it was very noisy. The door into our hallway (you have to be buzzed through 1 door, then use a key for your room door) was slamming shut every 5 minutes which was extremely annoying. The hotel has free internet access and 3 computers, but as someone below indicated, it's extremely difficult to use the computers due to the demand. The location was ok, although it's not far from the Termini station area which is a bit seedy. Not a horrible place, if you just need a place to sleep or are a kid trekking through europe, otherwise you should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: never ever stay in this dump. it smells of mould, the staff couldnt care less, the breakfast is rotten and the free internet is completely unaccessible due to the overcrowding of the hotel. I was there for 4 nights and each evening guests arrived and were promptly told that there was no room for them but not to worry because they had booked an alternative hotel. The management of this hotel are untrustworthy and only interested in 01 thing - Money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a nice hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: efhierst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel des Artistes for ten days this past January and for the most part found our stay pleasant. The location is excellent. For enthusiastic walkers most of central Rome is accessible; otherwise trains and buses are nearby. The staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable and the complimentary breakfasts were bountiful. The hotel is an excellent value. Our triple room, although charmingly decorated felt cramped. There was little room provided to spread out and feel "at home". It would have been nice to have some drawer space or even a few shelves. Even in the bathroom, there was meager room to place necessities or even a hook to hang a bathrobe. As it was, we lived out of our suitcases and tried to organize our clothing on the floor as best we could. Perhaps for a shorter say this would have been less an issue. For potential guests with problems climbing stairs, be aware that although the hotel has a lift, it is often out of commission (if the last user forgets to manually close the doors, the elevator will not operate). Since rooms can be a long climb to the 5th floor, consider this. This said, we recommend the Hotel des Artistes. The important things they get right: clean, pleasantly decorated rooms; good location; friendly staff; excellent value. How much time do you spend in your room while in Rome anyway? One more thing: restaurants in the vicinity of the hotel, even those we tried on the staff's recommendation were touristy and mediocre. With so many superb places to eat in Rome, unless your're exhausted, leave the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Hotel Des Artistes -- our room on the 5th floor (there IS a lift!) felt new and clean and well-kept, and had a queen-size bed, desk, cable TV, large closet and bathroom sink area with large mirrors. We used the bathrooms down the hall but never found a problem getting in, adn they were always clean. The rooftop balcony is large and GREAT! The room was quiet and the location was good for getting around, and it was really affordable. The free internet was a nice touch, even though one of the 3 computers was malfunctioning at the time... We stayed in February 2004 and would recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel des Artistes
HotelInfo.Address: Via Villafranca, 20, 00185 Rome, Italy
